Job_title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer, FinTech Remote
Description:
ViaBill operates at the intersection of the eCommerce, payments and consumer credit sectors, and is an industry pioneer and early market entrant in the BNPL industry, which is experiencing rapid growth. Becoming the best at something isn’t easy. It takes skill, hard work, and an unmatched level of ambition and determination. Our team is international, experienced and most of all, hardworking. In just a few years, we’ve grown from our first office in an art gallery in Denmark to having our teams located all over the globe.
From a handful of customers to handling transactions worth more than $150M per year, we aren’t afraid of new challenges and new markets. Our strategy has been validated with external investment from leading VCs Headline and BlackFin Capital Partners.

About The Role

Description:
Lead Instrument Engineer – Renewable Energy – Contract – Copenhagen

Are you a Lead Instrument Engineer looking for your next long-term contract? This is your chance to lead a major Power-to-X project utilising Hydrogen in Copenhagen!

Our client, a global provider of professional services in the energy, chemicals and resources sector are looking to onboard an experienced Instrument Engineer with a degree in engineering from April 2023. As the Project Manager, you will be a crucial contributor to the performance of the business unit. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a worldwide team of consultants, engineers, construction workers and data scientists on an initial 12-month contract.

The role consists of site work in Copenhagen, although some European travel is expected.


Work activities will include both project and proposal work where both the technical approach and continuity must be aligned
Work activities for both projects and proposals will be executed across all phases of projects including Conceptual Studies; Basic; FEED; Detailed Design; Procurement through to Commissioning.
Projects and proposals are for process plant and facilities across the Power and Energy Transition/ New Energy sectors
Project work will include development of Instrument Engineering deliverables as required on a project by project basis
Project work as the functional Lead Engineer for projects as required by the C&I Group Manager


Degree qualified for the related discipline
Chartered Engineer status as a Member of the Institute of Measurement and Control (IMC) or Institution of Engineering and Technology (IET).
20+ years’ experience Instrument Engineering
5 + years’ experience in a Lead role on capital projects from concept to start-up
Experience of working in a client facing large project group environment
Very good proactive communicator.
Experienced at controlling man-hour budgets and scheduled delivery
Proven ability for equipment specification and selection and in ensuring compliance from the suppliers, preferably within an EPC contracting organization
Is this Lead Instrument Engineer position a good fit for you? Get in touch with us today.

The candidate must have the rights to work in the location stated in the job advert.

Please note, Quanta part of QCS Staffing does not sponsor Visa applications.

Description:
Lead Structural Engineer – Renewable Energy – 12 Month Contract – Copenhagen

Are you a Senior Structural Engineer looking for your next long-term contract? This is your chance to support a major Power-to-X project utilising Hydrogen in Copenhagen!

Our client, a global provider of professional services in the energy, chemicals and resources sector are looking to onboard an experienced Structural Engineer with a degree in a relevant engineering discipline from April 2023. As the Lead Structural Engineer, you will join the Civil, Structural, Architectural and Weight Control department. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a worldwide team of consultants, engineers, construction workers and data scientists on an initial 12-month contract.

The role consists of site work in Copenhagen, although some European travel is expected.


Implement discipline improvements
Complete discipline audits and technical peer reviews
Maintain the required technical quality of work
Identify scope and schedule changes in accordance with the Change Control Process
Ensure that designs comply with the relevant procedures and regulations
Ensure as far as is practically possible, that all assigned work is carried out in compliance with agreed budget and schedule
Prepare estimates and schedules and assist in their review
Maintain good communication with the client and visit sites when necessary
Encourage and provide lateral learning within the project
Commit to and promote Worley values and ensure the realisation of company and project health, safety, environmental, quality and ethics, systems, policies and procedures


Degree in Engineering
Senior Project Management experience
Hydrogen, Power, Waste or Fuel industry experience
Greenfield project experience, from site selection through to delivery
Does this Lead Structural Engineer role sound like a great fit for you? We want to hear from you. Apply today.

Description:
Lead Electrical Engineer – Renewable Energy – Contract – Copenhagen

Are you a Lead Electrical Engineer looking for your next long-term contract? This is your chance to lead a major Power-to-X project utilising Hydrogen in Copenhagen!

Our client, a global provider of professional services in the energy, chemicals and resources sector are looking to onboard an experienced Electrical Engineer with a degree in engineering from April 2023. As the Project Manager, you will be a crucial contributor to the performance of the business unit. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a worldwide team of consultants, engineers, construction workers and data scientists on an initial 12-month contract.

The role consists of site work in Copenhagen, although some European travel is expected.


Manage electrical engineering services that meet our client’s and its customers' and applicable statutory and regulatory specifications, on time and within budget.
Manage electrical engineering project requirements.


participate in relevant meetings, prepare progress reports and comply with required checking procedures;
ensure the project scope is clear and that changes comply with project change management processes;
provide advice during procurement, construction and commissioning activities. For example, oversee requisitions, technical bid evaluations and purchase order preparation.

Communicate effectively with the electrical engineering team and project stakeholders, including the Customer.
Identify issues and problems, develop appropriate solutions, and ask for assistance when required.


Relevant engineering degree.
Chartered Professional Engineer (CPEng) status.
Relevant postgraduate qualifications in engineering; management, project management or supervisory qualifications or equivalent.
Excellent IT skills
Excellent technical and practical engineering skills and ability to consistently deliver quality, accurate and timely work to with our client and its clients.
Excellent knowledge of the fundamental requirements of the electrical engineering
Excellent knowledge of applicable local and international standards and regulatory specifications.
Is this Lead Electrical Engineer position a good fit for you? Get in touch with us today.

Description:
We seek a highly skilled and motivated data engineer to join our team. You will use various methods to transform raw data into useful data structures. You will build and maintain the infrastructure and tools needed to collect, process, store, and analyze large amounts of financial data, ensuring that the data is accurate, reliable, and accessible. You’ll create algorithms and conduct statistical analysis.
Vinter’s mission is to institutionalize crypto. We create and calculate complex and high-performant investment strategies used in financial products worldwide. Our customers are some of the most successful crypto funds in the world, and our investors are some of the most well-respected in the industry. We recently raised a $3.4M Series Seed and are looking to build one of the greatest teams in our industry.
Since our incorporation in 2019, we’ve been listed as a top European startup. Our team is a diverse group from over eight countries, speaking 13 languages.

Description:
Linkfire is looking for a full-time Data Engineer in Copenhagen, Lisbon or remote (EMEA) to support our missions to create value through data. You will join us to continue discovering and delivering new and exciting features for the 150+ million fans which we bring closer to their favorite artists every month.
You will join a company with roots and heart in music. We're a team of designers, engineers, product managers and more, drawn from every corner of the globe.
Our goal? Empowering entertainment discovery everywhere!

What you will do at Linkfire

Join the sustainability journey at NREP
NREP is a powerhouse of brilliant and caring people who are raising the bar for the industry. By improving the design, constrauction ans use of urban real estate - with sustainability at the core - they are driving change to create real impact. With a mission to be a global thought leader of urban ecosystems, investing for positive planetary impact, an ambitious goal to reach net zero carbon emissions by 2028. Using their data assets wisely and harvesting new insights from data is key to pushing forward this vision and goal. To keep on innovating and raising the bar for NREP’s data platform, they are now looking for a talented Data Engineer to a newly established role, who wants to embark on an ambitious growth path.

The Team

Help us shape the future of photography
Born out of a passion for photography, we provide photographers with the tools to easily collaborate with clients and creatives, achieve the highest quality photographs, and bring their visions to life. We are on a journey to become the most efficient ecosystem of creative and collaborative tools with a flexible photography workflow seamlessly spanning across multiple devices, letting you work from anywhere and with anyone.

The role
Analytics are at the heart of Capture One’s success. In this role, you will empower the business through connecting the data of our 250K+ global customers, which enables us to turn data into actionable insights in support of our ambitious growth goals.

Description:
Are you a curious aspiring Data Engineer with a passion for innovation and a desire to help shape the future of B2B credit and payment solutions? Do you love learning new things and making an impact with data? Then you might be the colleague that we’re looking for!
We are Risika - a Danish-founded FinTech scale-up on a mission to build the world's most flexible B2B solution that enables companies to balance growth and credit risk.
We’re looking for a curious Student Data Engineer to join our Business Intelligence team in Copenhagen. This is a great opportunity to be part of building a world-class analytics setup using the newest technologies - and you’ll surely learn a bunch along the way!
Oh, and our tech stack? We’re currently using SQL, Python, Docker, dbt, Tableau, Git, Airflow and more. We don’t expect you to know our tech-stack from the get go. The most important thing is that you are curious and have a natural interest in the field.

Description:
Do you want to create one of Telia's most central focus areas? We're on a change journey, looking for a Data Engineer for our analytics team. We have an important mission in suppling data to BI, Data Science & MarTech solutions.
Is this your next opportunity?
You will become part of an environment with other highly skilled data engineers. We are aiming towards building a team with a culture of collaboration, learning and personal development. We have full trust in each other and work with a high degree of freedom in a collaborative environment. We are excited about data, and we are an important contributor to Telia's journey towards becoming increasingly data oriented.
Your main mission will be to make data available on our platforms to solve the needs of our business. Our goal is to create a future-oriented innovative platform using modern technology that will meet the business's growing need for quick and good insights. We have started the process of becoming more vendor independent by transitioning to a code-based solution.

Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders—empowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact.

Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting, technology and design, and corporate and digital ventures. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, fueled by the goal of helping our clients thrive and enabling them to make the world a better place.

Description:
Data Engineer
Do you want to transform the way clinical data is efficiently handled and shared across the business – aspiring to create value throughout the value chain by enabling real-time analytics of our clinical data, including data from clinical studies, real world data, multi omics, images, streaming data and more?

We are looking for a Data Engineer who will join our efforts to sustain and further advance our ambition to become a global healthcare leader powered by data, analytics, and digital technologies – and drive change to help defeat diabetes and other chronic diseases.
If the above excites you, then join us in Data Science where you can get to put your skills into purposeful action to help build our next generation clinical data infrastructure. As a Data Engineer, you will be a part of driving outcomes and solutions that will transform the way we operate, and significantly impact the way we develop new medicines to patients, and value for Novo Nordisk Development.


As we have embarked on a transformation journey to build our Next Generation Data Infrastructure, we need a data engineer drive setting up the right data model across different data modalities considering both structured and less structured data types in high volumes. The infrastructure will cater for streaming analytics and FAIR data principles. With an ambitious vision to grow our activities 10X over the coming years we need to re-think how we enable a data seamless flow across clinical system ultimately enabling innovative medicines to patients faster and in the right quality. The program is anchored within Data Science in the Development organisation in Novo Nordisk (NN).

Description:
Do you like working with a variety of tasks, while always having a focus on developing high level technical solutions? Are you looking for a place where you explore and develop your skills in fields like code libraries, data pipelines and IaC. Does teamwork with daily discussions and input motivate you?
Then this job is the right one for you.
The Copenhagen Metro (Metroselskabet I/S) is looking for an experienced Data Engineer/Backend developer to join our DataLake team in the department of Digitalization and Technology. We expect that you are competent with designing, architecting, as well as developing solutions for a DataLake. We are using Google Cloud and want to strengthen the setup as well as build up an API-capability to receive data.
The DataLake already has several data sources but is going to increase this number over the coming years. Currently Data Lake includes data on KPI-measurement, automating data-triggered processes as well as advanced data analytics. In the future we want to include several IoT sources, build a data-driven ESG-reporting setup, utilize ML related to predictive maintenance, remove tedious tasks in business unit with data-driven automated support as well as start to use streaming data.

Description:
Are you passionate about data engineering and leading others who share your enthusiasm and do you want to be a part of data driven growth at the world’s largest jewellery brand?

Manage, engineer and evolve high quality data products across product lines on our Azure Paas data platform
At Pandora, we are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new manager of data engineer team you and your team will collaborate with product owners & managers, architects and other key profiles across the global organisation helping business verticals and clusters maximising the value of our data and drive business change as an impact of this. You will lead a team of equal minded data engineers at different seniority levels.

You will be responsible for delivering value-add products, ensuring high success rates as well as be an ambassador that data quality is always a priority. Your primary focus will be to secure that you and your team designs, builds and implements scalable and innovative data products on our global data platform and to secure ownership and stability of the products.

Description:
Brandwatch is the world’s premier social suite, empowering over 7,500 of the world’s most admired companies to understand and engage with customers at the speed of social.

Combining pioneering, AI-enriched digital consumer intelligence with industry-leading social media management tools, Brandwatch offers a complementary suite of specialized, best-in-class products and services that support intelligently connected workflows. With Brandwatch, brands and agencies can adapt and thrive in today’s fast moving digital world by making smarter decisions and executing data-driven social strategies at every customer touchpoint.

Operating and serving clients the world over, Brandwatch has 15 offices across the globe and more than 1,000 employees worldwide. Brandwatch is a Cision Company.

Brandwatch is looking for a new member for the Publish team. You will be part of a cross-functional and autonomous product team responsible to provide solutions to ideate, plan and publish content to social media like Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Twitter.

Description:
Do you want to develop, build and deliver advanced data products to support data-driven decision-making across the value chain of ECCO?
Join us at ECCO Advanced Analytics, located in Copenhagen, to help grow our advanced analytics platform and become one of the key enablers in our future setup. Making your mark on advanced data and platform engineering at ECCO will help strengthen the foundation for data science and analytics. We are highly motivated, collaborative and fun-loving, with an entrepreneurial spirit and a bias for action. Given a broad mandate to explore, experiment and innovate, we are growing at an unprecedented rate with a seemingly endless range of new opportunities.
JOB PROFILE
You will join highly skilled colleagues in Advanced Analytics. We lead our advanced analytics initiatives and capabilities in the ECCO Group and drive an ambitious strategy to support the transformation to a data-driven organization using the leading business principles herein. You will report to the Data & Platform Engineering Team Lead and work out of our office at Carlsbergbyen in Copenhagen.
As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our data delivery and developing our data models. You will work closely with our data scientists and analysts to deliver high-impact datasets and algorithms into our daily business operations and strategic initiatives.

Description:
Our Data team is growing, and we’re looking for an Analytics Engineer, a Data Engineer, and a Data Manager to join our team for continued development and improvement on the overall Data Strategy, how we manage data today, and most importantly, how we make data understandable for the organization.
At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. We have grown by leaps and bounds since starting out in Aarhus in 2015 and are now considered a major player in the Nordics with offices in Aarhus, Copenhagen, Stockholm, and Oslo, as well as employees working remotely across Europe.
As we’re moving closer to our Moon Landing strategy we’re looking for an Analytics Engineer to join our Data warehouse team (currently a team of 5), report to our Head of Data Warehouse Wojciech Witowski, and help us leverage data to drive innovation and growth. As an Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and implementing data analytics solutions, as well as maintaining and optimizing existing analytics systems.

This is the role

You will be at the heart of the collaboration between data analysts, scientists, engineers, and business teams, and will be responsible for bringing efficient and robust data models, BI interfaces, and self-service solutions to life.

The team offers a casual atmosphere with great opportunities to grow and make an impact, and you will in this position get the chance to play a leading role in shaping and driving our data modeling efforts.

Description:
Let’s reimagine how the world moves.
As an international business on a high-tech journey, we don’t just transport millions of tons of cargo. We’re leading a digital revolution in global trade, creating opportunities for millions of customers around the world through new technology, data science, and artificial intelligence.
Growing your skills with Maersk means growing global trade and reinventing our industry, creating a digital foundation that moves the world. But it also means creating life-enhancing prosperity for people and communities through exciting initiatives.
Where will your technology career move next?
Maersk offers a unique opportunity to be part of a truly global team working on optimizing, expanding, and refining the Workday and other HR Technology solutions within Maersk. You will be part of the HR Technology organization working across our Product delivery teams.

In the team we strive to be agile and move fast when needed. We want to go beyond issue diagnostics and be a proactive advisor on solutions and drive optimization of our processes and systems. Our main stakeholder is the HR organization, and we are here to support them. They come to us with global and local requirements, and we act as trusted advisors and listen and translate complex challenges to viable technical Workday solutions.

Description:
Description

Are you data-driven, and have a genuine interest in business analytics? Do you want to take the next step and work with a competent team to further develop your analytical and engineering skills? You might be the one for this job! We are looking for a new Business Data Engineer who wishes to join our team at the Copenhagen office.

As a Business Data Engineer at Gaming Innovation Group, you will be in charge of the data transformation and data pipeline tasks by delivering solutions and reports to each relevant vertical and department across the company. You will build scripts, clean and prepare datasets for the main stakeholders in the Business Intelligence unit. This role will let you collaborate with business partners and skillful team members so as to execute technical solutions that would be performant, scalable with best in class user experience.

We hope that you want to join our wonderful Business Analytics team

The best part about the workplace

Our international culture and office set up will make you not want to leave. A large open office with a gym, a cinema, a bar and much more! Office vibes are a big part of our culture and have been built to help motivate and inspire. We also offer a full range of support and mentoring to make sure you have the tools you need to succeed. If that is not enough, you will also have access to a full suite of internal and external resources to help power your knowledge and skill set!


Provide insights and interpret reports to a broad audience

Develop data models transformations and scripts to improve our automation pipelines

Translate business requirements into technical specifications

Provide comprehensive solutions using a variety of programming languages and data tools (e.g., querying data with SQL, build DBT transformations)

Build and test data models in order to make forecasts and predictions

Develop scalable solutions give from business stakeholders

Maintain and organize datasets and transformations among the different data sources

Collaborate with top management with ad hoc reporting/tasks requirements


For this full time-position, we are looking for a candidate who

Business work experience in data pipelines and automation

Previous experience with PostgreSQL or other SQL databases
Experience with data transformation tools. Experience with DBT will be an advantage

Experience with Python or other programming languages

Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization
General understanding of data orchestration and ETL. Airflow and Airbyte will be an advantage

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail

Be able to handle multiple tasks across different areas of the company

As we are inspired by diversity and willingness to learn, please feel free to apply even though you do not tick off all the boxes or have a different background you deem relevant. This is a perfect opportunity for anyone seeking to challenge themselves and want to develop both as a person and as a team. In GIG we work together!

Who we are

Gaming Innovation Group is an industry-leading iGaming and sports betting provider, working in one of the most competitive branches of online marketing. GiG is a multinational company with a vibrant company culture where GiGsters play hard but work even harder. On the Media (Marketing) side of the business, we are +150 employees, and we work with IT-driven marketing and offer marketing services to some of the biggest operators in the online sports betting and iGaming industry.

You will be in our office in Copenhagen in Nørrebro, where we have +60 Employees from around 20 different countries. We have a nice naturally lit open office space and here you will find a good mix of designers, writers, Marketing and IT people. Freedom with responsibility is a key term for us and we hope that you would join the fun and help the company grow to new heights.

Join us!

You can read more about us here.

https://www.gigmedia.com

Job_title: Integrated Logistics Support Engineer, Lystrup or Søborg
Description:
Would you like to work with Integrated Logistics Support for mission-critical products and high tech solutions? Join us and collaborate with dedicated and experienced colleagues across the organization to support our customers get the most out of their systems through the complete life span.
Operating in the aerospace, defense, and security sector, Terma supports customers and partners all over the world. In Terma Support & Services (TSS), Service Delivery we manage and deliver after-sales activities. These include after-sales projects, service contracts, technical support, incidents, problems, warranty handling and delivery of spare parts, repairs, training and onsite services.
We continuously develop our organization and evolve new services. Integrated Logistics & Support (ILS) is a method introduced within the US Defence domain to ensure that supportability is considered and implemented into the design and development of products and solutions. We are currently developing a new service concept around ILS. For that we need an ILS Engineer for the team.

Job_title: DATA ENGINEER, PROCESS DATA AND ANALYTICS, NOVOZYMES
Description:
Data Engineer with software development experience
Do you want to rethink your impact, and are you passionate about developing data platforms enabling digital transformation? Then you might be our new data engineer.

Work for a cause, not just a company
Novozymes is the world’s leading provider of industrial enzymes and microorganisms. Together with our customers, partners, and the global community, we use our innovative thinking and passion for science to boost industries and make everyday products more sustainable for the good of the planet. Our biological solutions enable higher agricultural yields, healthy food consumption, low-temperature washing, energy-efficient production, renewable fuel, and many other biological solutions that the world can benefit from – both today and in years to come. We need people who are eager to try new things, motivated by challenge, and not afraid to fail but driven to try again. And again. We know that original thinking happens when we’re given the flexibility to focus and the freedom to fully unfold our individual strengths. This is key to our innovation power. We call it Rethink Tomorrow.


We are looking for a data engineer that loves solving problems and issues together with competent colleagues to provide tools, software, and solution for our partners across the Novozymes organization. You are accustomed with bringing systems into production. You have experience supporting and handling data and users within an open-source toolkit from the OS upwards, dealing with multiple data sources, and supplying end users with systems and applications running in production. You have seen several different databases and know your way around dragging data out of legacy source systems.

Please note that we are looking for a person, who is motivated by the internal processes (ETLs, execution efficiency), have strong and disciplined software developing skills and is used to working in co-development communities. There will be limited Data Science elements in the position.


We are a multinational team of data scientists and engineers, based in Bagsværd (Copenhagen), Kalundborg and Warsaw (Poland). We are building data systems and applications to support decision making in our current industrial processes and drive new business opportunities. We build our platform to support researchers and scientists and give them access to state-of-the-art data science tools. We build the platform as Cloud-only and Open Source-first using the best technologies from both cloud providers as well as open-source projects to solve the tasks at hand. As the market leader in industrial biotechnology, we need to lead the way also in analytics and becoming data driven. We are driven by impact, curiosity and fun and we believe in continuous learning, both personally and professionally.

Day-to-day you will be working focused and agile on a project-by-project basis, in a cross-functional team assisted by subject matter experts and technical experts. The team is responsible for building and delivering production grade systems supporting Novozymes core business. We work by the Agile principles with focus on our user’s needs.

People development is a focus area in the daily work for all Zymers as well as continuous improvement of the way we work. Interaction with other departments is very strong, using both shared projects and actual job rotations to foster cooperation and people development.

When asked for input to describe our department, the answer is: We laugh a lot, we help each other, we have doubts and discussions about technical issues that we try to settle in the best manner, we respect each other, we reflect on our processes and code quality and strive to improve continuously – we are a mix of genders, nationalities and backgrounds, but we have in common kindness, humor and respect for differences.


You are an end-to-end problem solver who prefers to use the right tool for the job in close collaboration with your peers. You are accustomed with bringing systems into production. You have experience supporting and handling data and users within an open-source toolkit from the OS upwards, dealing with multiple data sources, and supplying end users with systems and applications running in production. You have seen several different databases and know your way around dragging data out of legacy source systems.





This job can be place in Bagsværd or Kalundborg, Denmark – we are using a hybrid-workplace model – working from home or onsite dependent onsite dependent on needs (most of us work from home 1-3 days a week).

Are you passionate about making a sustainable impact, and do you see yourself in this position? Then unlock your passion and apply today!

: April 1st 2023.

For more information, please contact Mads Thaysen (madt@novozymes.com or +45 3077 0109), Hilda Agnarsdottir (
or +45 3077 0518) or Mikołaj Habdank Wojewódzki (mhwe@novozymes.com or +45 3077 3606).

At Novozymes we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application and refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying.

Novozymes is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Description:
Who we are
At EIVEE, we’re on a mission to make a sustainable world possible and profitable. To achieve this, we target carbon emissions as well as costs, knowing that Procurement plays a foundational role in driving sustainability impacts and compliance. Because without transparency into what you buy and from where, how would you know how much that product or service emits?
We offer a state-of-the-art product that provides businesses with a high-quality and validated overview of their climate footprint and cost transparency with automated expert insights, and we do this through an innovative and ground-breaking SaaS-like business development platform. With our recently announced seed round of 4M€ and so many businesses that may benefit from our help, our market size is almost unlimited, and our growth potential enormous – which is why we need you.

Maersk is achieving an unprecedented transformation in the growth of our business, rethinking the way we engage with customers and partners, and how the world’s trade flows across our global network. From the farm to your refrigerator, or the factory to your wardrobe, we are developing solutions in-house that meet customer needs across the whole Supply Chain E2E. Joining Maersk you will join a global leader in Container Logistics as we embark on an industry-defining digital transformation that will revolutionize trade.
You’ll play a vital part in our success, helping us re-think what technology can do by using the latest technologies, and building the experience to advance your career. If you are passionate about working in an entrepreneurial environment supporting an ambitious, culturally diverse team of 3000 People within Maersk Technology – on a great transformation journey – then apply today!

Description:
Data Specialist, Snowflake Engineer - Copenhagen:
30012023DN_1675062009
Data Specialist, Snowflake Engineer - Copenhagen:

A data engineer using Snowflake is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the data infrastructure of an organisation. This includes creating data pipelines to collect, store, and process large datasets, as well as designing and implementing data models to support the organisation's data needs.

The data engineer will work closely with data scientists and analysts to understand the organisation's data requirements and design data systems that can handle the volume, velocity, and variety of data. They will also be responsible for ensuring the data infrastructure is scalable, reliable, and secure.


Key responsibilities of a data engineer using Snowflake include:




The data engineer should have strong technical skills, including experience with Snowflake, SQL, and other relevant technologies. They should also have experience with data modelling, data warehousing, and data pipeline design. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in a team environment are also important.

Working in a cross-collaborative way means that the team is focused on achieving the best possible results for the project, rather than just completing their individual tasks. This requires a high level of collaboration and communication among team members, as well as a willingness to share ideas and work together to solve problems.


Even if you feel you aren't a 100% fit, please still apply!

Job_title: Senior Software Engineer, Energy Transition Platform, Hybrid 2+ days on average in our fantastic office! (Full remote available in some cases)
Description:
As an integrated container logistics company, A.P. Moller - Maersk is working to connect and simplify our customers’ supply chains. Every day, we facilitate and impact global trade by offering end-to-end logistics solutions across oceans, ports, air and on land. Our global network enables people in every corner of the world to trade with anyone, anywhere – ultimately creating opportunities for people and communities to thrive, and for businesses to grow.
Why should you work on the Energy Transition Platform?
The world is facing a climate emergency. We see it as our obligation – as an industry leader and with the resources available to us – to do all we can to get to net zero operations as fast as possible and to help our customers decarbonize their global supply chains end to end.
As a key player in an industry responsible for 3.5 billion tons of annual direct emissions, A.P. Moller - Maersk (Maersk) is committed to leading the decarbonization of logistics and taking responsibility to be part of the solution, enabling a green and just transition. In early 2022, we announced the ambitious goal of advancing the target year for our commitment to reach net zero emissions by a full decade, to 2040. This applies to our own operations, but – even more importantly – covers all three emission scopes and supports our customers’ own climate commitments.

And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.
About the Team
As we grow the Peakon engineering team at Workday, we are looking for an experienced Senior Frontend Engineer to join us in Copenhagen. Peakon teams own their roadmap, work collaboratively and include engineering, UI/UX design, and product management.

The Peakon team at Workday is driven by the belief that we can radically change the world of work. We believe that when an organisation listens to employee feedback and empowers every employee to drive the change they want to see, it can create more fulfilling jobs and grow in ways never before imagined.

We’re in the business of creating great places to work, so it should be no surprise that being a great place to work is our highest priority. With ambitions as big as ours, we see individual growth and development as the key strategy for growing our business.

The role is on the Language team which is dedicated to ensure we create actionable insights utilising Natural Language Processing on our very large comment dataset. We build features that allow users to understand and action employee Engagement issues. With multiple data scientists on the team you’ll get a chance to implement cutting edge machine learning and data science technologies into the product.

Description:
Data Specialist, Snowflake Engineer - Copenhagen:
30012023DN_1675062009
Data Specialist, Snowflake Engineer - Copenhagen:

A data engineer using Snowflake is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the data infrastructure of an organisation. This includes creating data pipelines to collect, store, and process large datasets, as well as designing and implementing data models to support the organisation's data needs.

The data engineer will work closely with data scientists and analysts to understand the organisation's data requirements and design data systems that can handle the volume, velocity, and variety of data. They will also be responsible for ensuring the data infrastructure is scalable, reliable, and secure.


Key responsibilities of a data engineer using Snowflake include:




The data engineer should have strong technical skills, including experience with Snowflake, SQL, and other relevant technologies. They should also have experience with data modelling, data warehousing, and data pipeline design. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in a team environment are also important.

Working in a cross-collaborative way means that the team is focused on achieving the best possible results for the project, rather than just completing their individual tasks. This requires a high level of collaboration and communication among team members, as well as a willingness to share ideas and work together to solve problems.


Even if you feel you aren't a 100% fit, please still apply!

Description:
Pick a point on a globe, and Maersk won’t be far away. With 90% of global trade carried by sea, there is a high chance that the shoes on your feet or the phone in your pocket travelled to you on a Maersk vessel. Would you like to impact the daily lives of people in every corner of the world? Then keep reading.
What We Do
Come join us to help utilize technology to tackle the world’s CO2 challenge!

You’ve probably heard of or have even worked with IoT devices before. But have you ever heard of IoT devices that are close to half a kilometer long, weigh in at 300,000 metric tonnes and float around in the middle of the Pacific Ocean? Well, we are lucky enough to work with these floating mega devices! We are even more fortunate to be tackling one of the most pressing issues in the world today….global warming.
But how do you mix large IoT devices with global warming?

Glad you asked! Shipping contributes to 3% of global CO2 emissions, and Maersk, as the world’s leading shipping company, has a large responsibility to tackle this issue and drive the industry towards solutions. Each decision starts with data and knowing our vessels’ data (intimately ) is part of our mission.

As a member of the tech teams in StarConnect (as we call ourselves) you will contribute to tackling the carbon pollution issue by using technology. And help us monitor our fleet’s fuel and empower our seafarers to reduce our carbon emissions.

We’re progressing well on a journey to bring our 700 container vessels online by hooking up to countless sensors onboard. But this has proven to be quite the challenge! Hardware installations & upgrades, deploying our apps and dealing with limited connectivity on remote platforms are some of the daily challenges we face in Maersk Decarb. But nothing comes easy when you’re working with such grand ambitions!
We are looking for a Senior Frontend Software Engineer for our Technical Efficiency & Data Collection team.

The team is building products deployed to the full fleet of Maersk vessels sailing around the globe. The aim of the products is to collect, automate & validate performance data from the vessels. This data is then modelled and turned into user insights & advice for energy decisions on-board and in office.

The end goal of our products is to drive fuel savings & reduce emission, to support Maersk's ambitious carbon neutral targets.

Our team is diverse! We are representing 7 nationalities and a variety of professions and specialialities - all working towards a common goal of supporting our users to reduce fuel & helping make their life easier on-board!

We're looking for an open minded, skilled, and passionate team member to help us on our product journey.

Description:
Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a
culture of inclusion
for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Senior Software Engineer
Overview

You’ll be part of a development team in Copenhagen, providing account-to-account based omni channel services to banks, corporates and their customers. More than 90% of Danish households use these services to pay their bills.

We are looking for a highly motivated Java developer with strong technical commitment and a passion for software development and automated test disciplines. We base our software development on modern tech stack in languages, frameworks and technologies such as Java, Microservices-based & domain driven architecture, automated tests and continuous delivery and deployment.

Role

You will work in an agile iterative development cycle, in a high-performance team, target the best user experience for customers.






All About You











Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.

Job_title: Data Engineer til bekæmpelse af skatteunddragelse
Description:
Vil du være en del af et stærkt fagligt fællesskab? Er du interesseret i at arbejde med komplekse datastrukturer og samfundsvigtige opgaver? Så har vi brug for dig som ny Data Engineer!

Tre tidligere juniorer siger:

”Med forløbet er jeg kommet hurtigt ind i arbejdslivet og er blevet klædt på til at løse opgaver selvstændigt og udvikle effektivt”

” Der har været stort fokus på min udvikling og på at give mig de bedste forudsætninger for at lære. Mine kollegaer har været tålmodige og sikret at arbejdsbyrden ikke har taget overhånd”.



Vi søger flere nyuddannede Data Engineers til vores Data Engineer-forløb, der sætter din læring og kompetenceudvikling i centrum. Du får en unik mulighed for at deltage i et forløb, der er skræddersyet til juniorprofiler, og som giver dig de bedste forudsætninger for at udvikle din faglighed og for at få erfaring i en stor organisation.
DE-forløbet består af oplæg og workshops, som er tilrettelagt, udviklet og afholdt af dine kommende kollegaer i Data Warehouse og Business Intelligence. Forløbet sikrer en effektiv og målrettet onboarding, så du hurtigt får hands-on-erfaring.

Alle teams arbejder agilt inden for SAFe og har et årshjul med fire PI’s. Hvert PI afsluttes med tre dages Hackathon, der giver mere end 140 medarbejdere med forskellige fagligheder mulighed for at samarbejde på tværs om selvvalgte projekter.


Som Data Engineer bliver du en del af et stort fagligt fællesskab i Center for Data Warehouse og Business Intelligence, der består af 75+ medarbejdere, både Data Engineers, BI-udviklere, Business Analysts, Product Owners, driftsansvarlige og generalister.
Vi prioriterer tid til sparring og til at dyrke vores faglighed. Vi afholder tre årlige centerdage og et seminar med både interne og eksterne oplæg, workshops og indslag, der skal styrke vores sociale sammenhold og faglighed. Derudover har vi flere fagfællesskaber, hvori de forskellige fagligheder kan vidensdele og løse opgaver, der sikrer udvikling og forbedring af vores område.


Som Data Engineer er du bindeled mellem dataproducent og datakonsument, og du får ansvar for at indsamle, omforme, sammenstille og udveksle data på Skatteforvaltningens mange områder i vores fælles Data Warehouse.

Vi arbejder med SQL og Informatica, som er vores primære databaseværktøj. Informatica kan håndtere hele vores dataintegrations cyklus; fra indlæsning til udstilling. Det forventes ikke, at du har tidligere kendskab til værktøjet, og du vil få en grundig introduktion til det gennem onboardingforløbet.

Din rolle bliver bl.a. at:



Vi forestiller os, at du har en relevant videregående IT-faglig uddannelse, og at du har en særlig interesse for data. Du kan både være nyuddannet eller have erfaring.

Du har oparbejdet kompetencer eller interesser inden for et eller flere af områderne:


Det er desuden en fordel, hvis du har erfaring med programmering i Python, bearbejdning af semistruktureret data (XML, JSON) og ETL-processer generelt.

Koncernsproget er dansk, så vi forventer, at du kan forstå og formulere dig på dansk – både skriftligt og mundtligt.


Din leder i Data Warehouse stiller store krav til sig selv og sine medarbejdere, og har et højt ambitionsniveau på fagområdets vegne, men går ikke på kompromis med medarbejdernes trivsel. Fleksibilitet og en god work-life-balance er grundstenen i et bæredygtigt arbejdsliv. Du får en inkluderende leder, der går ind for åben og ærlig dialog. En leder, der giver ansvar, plads og medbestemmelse – fordi det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde!


Send din ansøgning med CV, dokumentation for uddannelse samt eventuelt yderligere materiale via linket ”Søg stillingen” senest mandag den 4. juni 2023. Vi indkalder løbende til samtaler.

Stillingen er med opstart 15. august 2023.

Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte kontorchef Astrid Iversen på tlf. 72 37 06 18.

Vi forventer at benytte en personlighedsanalyse og en logisk test i rekrutteringsprocessen. Der vil forud for ansættelsen blive indhentet straffeattest.

Du bliver ansat på overenskomstvilkår i henhold til gældende overenskomst for akademikere i staten, overenskomst for kontorfunktionærer, laboranter og IT-medarbejdere (HK) eller overenskomst for fuldmægtige m.fl. (DTS) i Skatteministeriet.

Ansættelsesområdet er Skatteministeriet med tilhørende institutioner. Arbejdsstedet er Osvald Helmuths Vej 4, 2000 Frederiksberg.

Job_title: Senior Software Engineer – PurpleSea Distributed Cache
Description:

Description:
ONNEC Group are a leading independent technology partner and global integrator, with over 30 years experience, and a 800+ team of global experts, specialising in providing end-to-end connectivity solutions that propel organisations everywhere.
We are a rapidly growing organisation and finding and retaining the highest calibre of people is fundamental to us for the success of our business, we work hard to create a challenging, supportive and satisfying working environment for all our employees. ONNEC has successfully achieved the Investors in Diversity Foundational Award for our commitment to equality, diversity and inclusion in the workplace.
Onnec Group is a leading multinational group of companies with our headquarter in London. We are active in the field of infrastructure for Telecommunications, Data Centres & smart buildings. In addition, we are providing distinguished IT managed services & smart hands to our clients. We have dozens of ongoing projects around the globe. We are looking to prequalify MAC Engineer to work with us as an independent subcontractor in our projects.

Description:
One of 3Shape priorities is to utilize cloud providers for us to deliver services internally as well as externally to our customers. To do so, we are growing our services in Microsoft Azure, our primary cloud provider.
We are using our cloud providers for IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS, and to support us going forward we want to grow our capabilities and responsibilities by building a Cloud Center of Excellence.
We are looking for a Cloud Engineer who preferably has operations experience. The position is in a team who is currently involved in DevOps for a number of projects, however it is likely that this team will be part of the future R&D Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE).
The team is responsible for some central services in the cloud today, and we want to add more DevOps capabilities to support the projects in the department. Together with the rest of 3Shape we will work on setting the standards for DevOps in Azure including helping the projects adding more focus on Infrastructure as Code, monitoring, and assisting the teams managing the infrastructure.

Job_title: Data engineer med øje for den tværgående arkitektur
Description:
Om stillingen Statens BI sikrer, at beslutninger træffes på et oplyst og korrekt grundlag. Med data som fundament gør vi viden tilgængelig og visualiseret i den kontekst som vores kunder ønsker.

Vi har et klart og tydeligt mål om at skabe gennemsigtighed for den enkelte regnskabsbruger og at understøtte styring og resultatskabelse i de enkelte institutioner. Samtidigt skal vi opfylde Finansministeriets behov for konsolidering af viden og tværgående analyser i forbindelse med udarbejdelse af finansloven.

Det er et spændende, kompliceret og et særdeles aktuelt arbejde, hvor den enkeltes indsats kan måles direkte i de beslutninger, der træffes. BI er et strategisk vigtigt indsatsområde i Finansministeriet, hvilket afspejles i vores arbejde og den gode energi, hvormed vi tilgår vores opgaver.

Statens BI undergår konstant forandring og i takt med den teknologiske udvikling ændres brugernes behov. Derfor er vi gået i gang med at definere den næste generation af Statens BI, så hvis du vil være med til at forme fremtidens forretningsservices og teknologi for Statens BI, er det nu du skal med på rejsen.

Vi søger lige nu en eller flere data engineers, der i samarbejde med vores Product Owners, kan skabe sammenhæng på tværs af løsninger og arkitektur og sikre, at vi følger best practics. Statens BI er bygget på teknologi fra Microsoft.

Om dig Vi ser gerne, at du har følgende færdigheder:


Du vil blandt andet komme til at arbejde med:


Derudover vil du indgå i arbejdet med at definere og implementere den næste generation af Statens BI.

Om os Vi garanterer et meningsfuldt job, hvor faglige udfordringer og personlig udvikling er i fokus fra første dag. Vores BI-team består af 17 gode kollegaer, hvor faglighed og godt humør er i højsædet, for det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde.

BI-teamet indgår i Økonomistyrelsens Center for Systemer, som er et af de største it-udviklingsmiljøer i staten. I Systemcenteret er vi i alt 160 dygtige og ambitiøse it-specialister, der arbejder med it-udvikling, drift, support, infrastruktur, arkitektur og sikkerhed – alt sammen i tæt dialog med og inddragelse af vores kunder.

Hos os betyder tilstedeværelse sammen med vores kollegaer meget, og vi mener, at samarbejde og videndeling på tværs af styrelsen er afgørende for et godt arbejdsmiljø. Samtidig vil vi gerne sikre fleksibilitet for vores medarbejdere, og hjemmearbejde kan løbende aftales mellem chef og medarbejder, når det er foreneligt med opgavevaretagelsen.

Ansættelsesvilkår Du ansættes efter gældende overenskomst med mulighed for forhandling alt efter kvalifikationer.

Det er en forudsætning for ansættelse, at du kan sikkerhedsgodkendes til graden hemmeligt og efterfølgende kan opretholde sikkerhedsgodkendelsen i hele din ansættelsesperiode.

Ansættelsesområdet er Finansministeriet med tilhørende institutioner, pt. Finansministeriets departement, Statens Administration, Statens It, Økonomistyrelsen samt Medarbejder- og Kompetencestyrelsen.

Yderligere oplysninger Hvis du vil vide mere om stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte teamleder Morten Bødtcher på tlf. 20 35 01 79.

Ansøgning Vi ser frem til at modtage din ansøgning med CV, eksamenspapirer og eventuelle bilag via knappen ”Søg stillingen” senest den 17. april 2023.

Finansministeriet ser mangfoldighed som en styrke og opfordrer alle interesserede kandidater uanset personlig baggrund til at søge. Vi ser frem til at læse din ansøgning.

Staff Engineer. The title means different things at different companies. At Pleo we want our Staff Engineers to be in a technical leadership role. What does that mean? While working within a team, you’ll spend a small portion of your time coding. Primarily within the Core Experience team, helping improve features that sit across all of the Pleo platform.
The other part of being a Staff Engineer at Pleo, we want you to be empowered to take a look across Pleo to identify, build and deliver systemic improvements to help everyone be better. The glue between engineering teams, helping facilitate the technical vision for an area and then helping people move towards that vision. A great staff engineer finds and identifies a niche that needs a champion, and improves it without oversight.
We’re investing into building sensible default technology solutions and golden paths to empower teams.

Description:
Data Engineer Director – Join Our Revolutionary Healthcare Data Insights program at Novo Nordisk

Are you a data engineer who is passionate about making a real impact on the healthcare industry? Do you dream of transforming the way clinical data is handled and shared across the business, with the potential to create value throughout the value chain? If you're excited about enabling real-time access and analysis of clinical data, including RCT, real-world data, multi-omics, images, streaming data, and more, then we have an opportunity you don´t want to miss.


We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Engineer Director to join our team and help us become a global healthcare leader powered by data, analytics, and digital technologies. As a Data Engineer Director, you will play a critical role in building our state-of-the-art data insights platform, FounData, and developing outcomes and solutions that will transform the way we operate. You'll work alongside top talent in the industry and make a significant impact on the way we develop new medicines, improve quality, and create value for Novo Nordisk Development and Novo Nordisk at large.


The FounData program is a new R&D data insights initiative designed to enhance data storage, curation/handling, analysis, and visualizations relevant to the entire organization. This initiative is set to revolutionize the way we use data in decision-making by enabling data availability from a one-stop clinical data shop. To achieve this, we require robust data pipelines and data models across various data modalities. The program is anchored within Data Science in the Development organization in Novo Nordisk (NN), and we aim to create a solution that spans the value chain.

Description:
Pick a point on a globe, and Maersk won’t be far away. With 90% of global trade carried by sea, there is a high chance that the shoes on your feet or the phone in your pocket travelled to you on a Maersk vessel. Would you like to impact the daily lives of people in every corner of the world? Then keep reading.
What We Do
Come join us to help utilize technology to tackle the world’s CO2 challenge!

You’ve probably heard of or have even worked with IoT devices before. But have you ever heard of IoT devices that are close to half a kilometer long, weigh in at 300,000 metric tonnes and float around in the middle of the Pacific Ocean? Well, we are lucky enough to work with these floating mega devices! We are even more fortunate to be tackling one of the most pressing issues in the world today….global warming.
But how do you mix large IoT devices with global warming?

Glad you asked! Shipping contributes to 3% of global CO2 emissions, and Maersk, as the world’s leading shipping company, has a large responsibility to tackle this issue and drive the industry towards solutions. Each decision starts with data and knowing our vessels’ data (intimately ) is part of our mission.

As a member of the tech teams in StarConnect (as we call ourselves) you will contribute to tackling the carbon pollution issue by using technology. And help us monitor our fleet’s fuel and empower our seafarers to reduce our carbon emissions.

We’re progressing well on a journey to bring our 700 container vessels online by hooking up to countless sensors onboard. But this has proven to be quite the challenge! Hardware installations & upgrades, deploying our apps and dealing with limited connectivity on remote platforms are some of the daily challenges we face in Maersk Decarb. But nothing comes easy when you’re working with such grand ambitions!
We are looking for a Senior Frontend Software Engineer for our Technical Efficiency & Data Collection team.

The team is building products deployed to the full fleet of Maersk vessels sailing around the globe. The aim of the products is to collect, automate & validate performance data from the vessels. This data is then modelled and turned into user insights & advice for energy decisions on-board and in office.

The end goal of our products is to drive fuel savings & reduce emission, to support Maersk's ambitious carbon neutral targets.

Our team is diverse! We are representing 7 nationalities and a variety of professions and specialialities - all working towards a common goal of supporting our users to reduce fuel & helping make their life easier on-board!

We're looking for an open minded, skilled, and passionate team member to help us on our product journey.

Description:
Your work days are brighter here.
At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.
About the Team
As we grow the Peakon engineering team at Workday, we are looking for an experienced Senior Frontend Engineer to join us in Copenhagen. Peakon teams own their roadmap, work collaboratively and include engineering, UI/UX design, and product management.

The Peakon team at Workday is driven by the belief that we can radically change the world of work. We believe that when an organisation listens to employee feedback and empowers every employee to drive the change they want to see, it can create more fulfilling jobs and grow in ways never before imagined.

We’re in the business of creating great places to work, so it should be no surprise that being a great place to work is our highest priority. With ambitions as big as ours, we see individual growth and development as the key strategy for growing our business.

The role is on the Language team which is dedicated to ensure we create actionable insights utilising Natural Language Processing on our very large comment dataset. We build features that allow users to understand and action employee Engagement issues. With multiple data scientists on the team you’ll get a chance to implement cutting edge machine learning and data science technologies into the product.

Description:
Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a
culture of inclusion
for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Senior Software Engineer
Overview

You’ll be part of a development team in Copenhagen, providing account-to-account based omni channel services to banks, corporates and their customers. More than 90% of Danish households use these services to pay their bills.

We are looking for a highly motivated Java developer with strong technical commitment and a passion for software development and automated test disciplines. We base our software development on modern tech stack in languages, frameworks and technologies such as Java, Microservices-based & domain driven architecture, automated tests and continuous delivery and deployment.

Role

You will work in an agile iterative development cycle, in a high-performance team, target the best user experience for customers.






All About You

Description:
Your work days are brighter here.
At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.
About the Team
As we grow the Peakon engineering team at Workday, we are looking for a Backend Engineer to join one of your product teams based in Copenhagen. Peakon teams own their roadmap, work collaboratively and include engineering, UI/UX design, and product management.

The Peakon team at Workday is driven by the belief that we can radically change the world of work. We believe that when an organisation listens to employee feedback and empowers every employee to drive the change they want to see, it can build more fulfilling jobs and grow in ways never before envisioned.

We’re in the business of creating great places to work, so it should be no surprise that being a great place to work is our highest priority. With ambitions as big as ours, we see individual growth and development as the key strategy for growing our business.

Description:
Din afdeling
i Inspari
Du vil blive en del af et hold af konsulenter, der består af Data Engineers, forretningskonsulenter og projektledere på forskellige niveauer og med hver sine spidskompetencer.
Vi arbejder i faste teams, hvilket giver gode muligheder for at opbygge tætte kollegiale relationer. Vi arbejder sammen på projekter og prioriterer samarbejde og kommunikation. Det er sjovt og givende at være en del af en enhed, hvor vi har en stor følelse af samhørighed til både det nære og det større Inspari.
Vi arbejder på projekter på tværs af forskellige industrier og projekttyper. Fælles for alle projekter er kunder, der ønsker større indsigt i brugen af data. Vores ekspertise og viden om, hvordan man skaber værdi ud af investeringer i data, er det, vi tilbyder - og oplever stor efterspørgsel på.

Job_title: Software Engineer, Energy Transition Platform, Hybrid 2+ days on average in our fantastic office! (Full remote available in some cases)
Description:
As an integrated container logistics company, A.P. Moller - Maersk is working to connect and simplify our customers’ supply chains. Every day, we facilitate and impact global trade by offering end-to-end logistics solutions across oceans, ports, air and on land. Our global network enables people in every corner of the world to trade with anyone, anywhere – ultimately creating opportunities for people and communities to thrive, and for businesses to grow.
Why should you work on the Energy Transition Platform?
The world is facing a climate emergency. We see it as our obligation – as an industry leader and with the resources available to us – to do all we can to get to net zero operations as fast as possible and to help our customers decarbonize their global supply chains end to end.
As a key player in an industry responsible for 3.5 billion tons of annual direct emissions, A.P. Moller - Maersk (Maersk) is committed to leading the decarbonization of logistics and taking responsibility to be part of the solution, enabling a green and just transition. In early 2022, we announced the ambitious goal of advancing the target year for our commitment to reach net zero emissions by a full decade, to 2040. This applies to our own operations, but – even more importantly – covers all three emission scopes and supports our customers’ own climate commitments.

Job_title: Data Engineer til bekæmpelse af skatteunddragelse
Description:
Vil du være en del af et stærkt fagligt fællesskab? Er du interesseret i at arbejde med komplekse datastrukturer og samfundsvigtige opgaver? Så har vi brug for dig som ny Data Engineer!

Tre tidligere juniorer siger:

”Med forløbet er jeg kommet hurtigt ind i arbejdslivet og er blevet klædt på til at løse opgaver selvstændigt og udvikle effektivt”

” Der har været stort fokus på min udvikling og på at give mig de bedste forudsætninger for at lære. Mine kollegaer har været tålmodige og sikret at arbejdsbyrden ikke har taget overhånd”.



Vi søger flere nyuddannede Data Engineers til vores Data Engineer-forløb, der sætter din læring og kompetenceudvikling i centrum. Du får en unik mulighed for at deltage i et forløb, der er skræddersyet til juniorprofiler, og som giver dig de bedste forudsætninger for at udvikle din faglighed og for at få erfaring i en stor organisation.
DE-forløbet består af oplæg og workshops, som er tilrettelagt, udviklet og afholdt af dine kommende kollegaer i Data Warehouse og Business Intelligence. Forløbet sikrer en effektiv og målrettet onboarding, så du hurtigt får hands-on-erfaring.

Alle teams arbejder agilt inden for SAFe og har et årshjul med fire PI’s. Hvert PI afsluttes med tre dages Hackathon, der giver mere end 140 medarbejdere med forskellige fagligheder mulighed for at samarbejde på tværs om selvvalgte projekter.


Som Data Engineer bliver du en del af et stort fagligt fællesskab i Center for Data Warehouse og Business Intelligence, der består af 75+ medarbejdere, både Data Engineers, BI-udviklere, Business Analysts, Product Owners, driftsansvarlige og generalister.
Vi prioriterer tid til sparring og til at dyrke vores faglighed. Vi afholder tre årlige centerdage og et seminar med både interne og eksterne oplæg, workshops og indslag, der skal styrke vores sociale sammenhold og faglighed. Derudover har vi flere fagfællesskaber, hvori de forskellige fagligheder kan vidensdele og løse opgaver, der sikrer udvikling og forbedring af vores område.


Som Data Engineer er du bindeled mellem dataproducent og datakonsument, og du får ansvar for at indsamle, omforme, sammenstille og udveksle data på Skatteforvaltningens mange områder i vores fælles Data Warehouse.

Vi arbejder med SQL og Informatica, som er vores primære databaseværktøj. Informatica kan håndtere hele vores dataintegrations cyklus; fra indlæsning til udstilling. Det forventes ikke, at du har tidligere kendskab til værktøjet, og du vil få en grundig introduktion til det gennem onboardingforløbet.

Din rolle bliver bl.a. at:



Vi forestiller os, at du har en relevant videregående IT-faglig uddannelse, og at du har en særlig interesse for data. Du kan både være nyuddannet eller have erfaring.

Du har oparbejdet kompetencer eller interesser inden for et eller flere af områderne:


Det er desuden en fordel, hvis du har erfaring med programmering i Python, bearbejdning af semistruktureret data (XML, JSON) og ETL-processer generelt.

Koncernsproget er dansk, så vi forventer, at du kan forstå og formulere dig på dansk – både skriftligt og mundtligt.


Din leder i Data Warehouse stiller store krav til sig selv og sine medarbejdere, og har et højt ambitionsniveau på fagområdets vegne, men går ikke på kompromis med medarbejdernes trivsel. Fleksibilitet og en god work-life-balance er grundstenen i et bæredygtigt arbejdsliv. Du får en inkluderende leder, der går ind for åben og ærlig dialog. En leder, der giver ansvar, plads og medbestemmelse – fordi det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde!


Send din ansøgning med CV, dokumentation for uddannelse samt eventuelt yderligere materiale via linket ”Søg stillingen” senest mandag den 4. juni 2023. Vi indkalder løbende til samtaler.

Stillingen er med opstart 15. august 2023.

Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte kontorchef Astrid Iversen på tlf. 72 37 06 18.

Vi forventer at benytte en personlighedsanalyse og en logisk test i rekrutteringsprocessen. Der vil forud for ansættelsen blive indhentet straffeattest.

Du bliver ansat på overenskomstvilkår i henhold til gældende overenskomst for akademikere i staten, overenskomst for kontorfunktionærer, laboranter og IT-medarbejdere (HK) eller overenskomst for fuldmægtige m.fl. (DTS) i Skatteministeriet.

Ansættelsesområdet er Skatteministeriet med tilhørende institutioner. Arbejdsstedet er Osvald Helmuths Vej 4, 2000 Frederiksberg.

Description:
Why should you work on the Energy Transition Platform?

The world is facing a climate emergency. We see it as our obligation – as an industry leader and with the resources available to us – to do all we can to get to net zero operations as fast as possible and to help our customers decarbonize their global supply chains end to end.
As a key player in an industry responsible for 3.5 billion tons of annual direct emissions, A.P. Moller - Maersk (Maersk) is committed to leading the decarbonization of logistics and taking responsibility to be part of the solution, enabling a green and just transition. In early 2022, we announced the ambitious goal of advancing the target year for our commitment to reach net zero emissions by a full decade, to 2040. This applies to our own operations, but – even more importantly – covers all three emission scopes and supports our customers’ own climate commitments.
In 2022, we improved our methodologies for scope calculations, allowing us to report more precise figures which increase the total emissions reported. Scope 3 calculations remain an evolving science, and our footprint will continue to evolve with more accurate data, and due to acquisitions and changes in our business.

Description:
Department: R&D
Are you passionate about delivering high-quality software to the market?
Do you strive to work on a methodical approach to testing our latest suite of software that will be driving a range of Phase One cameras that lead the world in terms of quality?
Phase One is a leading researcher, developer and manufacturer of medium format and large format digital cameras, software, and imaging solutions. We offer a dynamic workplace that is fuelled by innovation and passionate collaboration and take pride in developing cutting-edge technology and products. Our leading position in the world market requires employees with qualifications and competence to maintain and further develop our products and market position. To achieve this we hire dynamic, diverse, and dedicated people.

Join forces with a skilled engineering team that puts quality first in what it builds and how!
We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer (PHP) to join our Google Sheets team in Helsinki or Vilnius. You can also work fully remotely from Ireland, Poland, Portugal, Spain or the UK.

In this role, you will…
Build a new type of add-on, together with the team. A Google Workspace add.on, which will break the Google Sheets boundaries.
Scale our data delivering capabilities by breaking apart and reconstructing existing solutions

Description:
As a purpose-driven company with a heritage of leading shipping companies, we build and deliver a groundbreaking SaaS solution to change the shipping industry through digitalisation. We strive to help our customers optimise their business while reducing CO2 emissions. This is what empowers us.
Today, we are 150+ employees and more than 30 nationalities spread across offices in Copenhagen HQ, Athens, Varna, Mumbai, Singapore and New York City.
With a recent Series B capital raise of +$50 Mil, we are in a position to challenge the status quo. We proudly support the industry’s green transition and enable our customers to turn data into immediate decarbonisation actions.

THE ROLE
