Description:
Pick a point on a globe, and Maersk won’t be far away. With 90% of global trade carried by sea, there is a high chance that the shoes on your feet or the phone in your pocket travelled to you on a Maersk vessel. Would you like to impact the daily lives of people in every corner of the world? Then keep reading.
What We Do
Come join us to help utilize technology to tackle the world’s CO2 challenge!

You’ve probably heard of or have even worked with IoT devices before. But have you ever heard of IoT devices that are close to half a kilometer long, weigh in at 300,000 metric tonnes and float around in the middle of the Pacific Ocean? Well, we are lucky enough to work with these floating mega devices! We are even more fortunate to be tackling one of the most pressing issues in the world today….global warming.
But how do you mix large IoT devices with global warming?

Glad you asked! Shipping contributes to 3% of global CO2 emissions, and Maersk, as the world’s leading shipping company, has a large responsibility to tackle this issue and drive the industry towards solutions. Each decision starts with data and knowing our vessels’ data (intimately ) is part of our mission.

As a member of the tech teams in StarConnect (as we call ourselves) you will contribute to tackling the carbon pollution issue by using technology. And help us monitor our fleet’s fuel and empower our seafarers to reduce our carbon emissions.

We’re progressing well on a journey to bring our 700 container vessels online by hooking up to countless sensors onboard. But this has proven to be quite the challenge! Hardware installations & upgrades, deploying our apps and dealing with limited connectivity on remote platforms are some of the daily challenges we face in Maersk Decarb. But nothing comes easy when you’re working with such grand ambitions!
We are looking for a Senior Frontend Software Engineer for our Technical Efficiency & Data Collection team.

The team is building products deployed to the full fleet of Maersk vessels sailing around the globe. The aim of the products is to collect, automate & validate performance data from the vessels. This data is then modelled and turned into user insights & advice for energy decisions on-board and in office.

The end goal of our products is to drive fuel savings & reduce emission, to support Maersk's ambitious carbon neutral targets.

Our team is diverse! We are representing 7 nationalities and a variety of professions and specialialities - all working towards a common goal of supporting our users to reduce fuel & helping make their life easier on-board!

We're looking for an open minded, skilled, and passionate team member to help us on our product journey.

Description:
Your work days are brighter here.
At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.
About the Team
As we grow the Peakon engineering team at Workday, we are looking for an experienced Senior Frontend Engineer to join us in Copenhagen. Peakon teams own their roadmap, work collaboratively and include engineering, UI/UX design, and product management.

The Peakon team at Workday is driven by the belief that we can radically change the world of work. We believe that when an organisation listens to employee feedback and empowers every employee to drive the change they want to see, it can create more fulfilling jobs and grow in ways never before imagined.

We’re in the business of creating great places to work, so it should be no surprise that being a great place to work is our highest priority. With ambitions as big as ours, we see individual growth and development as the key strategy for growing our business.

The role is on the Language team which is dedicated to ensure we create actionable insights utilising Natural Language Processing on our very large comment dataset. We build features that allow users to understand and action employee Engagement issues. With multiple data scientists on the team you’ll get a chance to implement cutting edge machine learning and data science technologies into the product.

Description:
Senior Data Engineer
Description
Maersk is achieving an unprecedented transformation in the growth of our business, rethinking the way we engage with customers and partners, and how the world’s trade flows across our global network. From the farm to your refrigerator, or the factory to your wardrobe, we are developing solutions in-house that meet customer needs across the whole Supply Chain E2E. Joining Maersk you will join a global leader in Container Logistics as we embark on an industry-defining digital transformation that will revolutionize trade.
You’ll play a vital part in our success, helping us re-think what technology can do by using the latest technologies, and building the experience to advance your career. If you are passionate about working in an entrepreneurial environment supporting an ambitious, culturally diverse team of 3000 People within Maersk Technology – on a great transformation journey – then apply today!

Description:
Let’s reimagine how the world moves.
As an international business on a high-tech journey, we don’t just transport millions of tons of cargo. We’re leading a digital revolution in global trade, creating opportunities for millions of customers around the world through new technology, data science, and artificial intelligence.
Growing your skills with Maersk means growing global trade and reinventing our industry, creating a digital foundation that moves the world. But it also means creating life-enhancing prosperity for people and communities through exciting initiatives.
Where will your technology career move next?

Ensure right quality of all deliverables…
Write and execute test cases, both manual and automated compare tests

Din afdeling
i Inspari
Du vil blive en del af et hold af konsulenter, der består af Data Engineers, forretningskonsulenter og projektledere på forskellige niveauer og med hver sine spidskompetencer.
Vi arbejder i faste teams, hvilket giver gode muligheder for at opbygge tætte kollegiale relationer. Vi arbejder sammen på projekter og prioriterer samarbejde og kommunikation. Det er sjovt og givende at være en del af en enhed, hvor vi har en stor følelse af samhørighed til både det nære og det større Inspari.
Vi arbejder på projekter på tværs af forskellige industrier og projekttyper. Fælles for alle projekter er kunder, der ønsker større indsigt i brugen af data. Vores ekspertise og viden om, hvordan man skaber værdi ud af investeringer i data, er det, vi tilbyder - og oplever stor efterspørgsel på.

Description:
Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a
culture of inclusion
for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Senior Software Engineer
Overview

You’ll be part of a development team in Copenhagen, providing account-to-account based omni channel services to banks, corporates and their customers. More than 90% of Danish households use these services to pay their bills.

We are looking for a highly motivated Java developer with strong technical commitment and a passion for software development and automated test disciplines. We base our software development on modern tech stack in languages, frameworks and technologies such as Java, Microservices-based & domain driven architecture, automated tests and continuous delivery and deployment.

Role

You will work in an agile iterative development cycle, in a high-performance team, target the best user experience for customers.






All About You











Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.

Job_title: Software Engineer, Energy Transition Platform, Hybrid 2+ days on average in our fantastic office! (Full remote available in some cases)
Description:
As an integrated container logistics company, A.P. Moller - Maersk is working to connect and simplify our customers’ supply chains. Every day, we facilitate and impact global trade by offering end-to-end logistics solutions across oceans, ports, air and on land. Our global network enables people in every corner of the world to trade with anyone, anywhere – ultimately creating opportunities for people and communities to thrive, and for businesses to grow.
Why should you work on the Energy Transition Platform?
The world is facing a climate emergency. We see it as our obligation – as an industry leader and with the resources available to us – to do all we can to get to net zero operations as fast as possible and to help our customers decarbonize their global supply chains end to end.
As a key player in an industry responsible for 3.5 billion tons of annual direct emissions, A.P. Moller - Maersk (Maersk) is committed to leading the decarbonization of logistics and taking responsibility to be part of the solution, enabling a green and just transition. In early 2022, we announced the ambitious goal of advancing the target year for our commitment to reach net zero emissions by a full decade, to 2040. This applies to our own operations, but – even more importantly – covers all three emission scopes and supports our customers’ own climate commitments.

Description:
WHO WE ARE
For over 50 years, we have worked closely with investment and asset managers to become the world’s leading provider of integrated investment management solutions. We are 2,100+ colleagues with a broad range of nationalities, educations, professional experiences, ages, and backgrounds in general.
SimCorp is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a culture where diverse perspectives and expertise are integrated in our everyday work. We believe in the continual growth and development of our employees, so that we can provide best-in-class solutions to our clients.
While striving to deliver client value, we believe it is vital to consider our people and our planet in every business decision we make. Acting responsibly is not optional. It is essential.
WHY THIS ROLE IS IMPORTANT TO US
High-quality, performing, secure, and cost-effective software is at the core of what we do. To build and maintain this software, software engineers are essential to us.

Description:
As an Engineering Director within our Platform Engineering team, you will be responsible for building a team to deliver a new and innovative platform to Maersk. You will create a world class development team responsible for building a single CI/CD system for all the developers at Maersk. Job_title: Lead Engineer, Energy Transition Platform, Hybrid 2+ days on average in our fantastic office! (Full remote available in some cases)
Description:
Why should you work on the Energy Transition Platform?

The world is facing a climate emergency. We see it as our obligation – as an industry leader and with the resources available to us – to do all we can to get to net zero operations as fast as possible and to help our customers decarbonize their global supply chains end to end.
As a key player in an industry responsible for 3.5 billion tons of annual direct emissions, A.P. Moller - Maersk (Maersk) is committed to leading the decarbonization of logistics and taking responsibility to be part of the solution, enabling a green and just transition. In early 2022, we announced the ambitious goal of advancing the target year for our commitment to reach net zero emissions by a full decade, to 2040. This applies to our own operations, but – even more importantly – covers all three emission scopes and supports our customers’ own climate commitments.
In 2022, we improved our methodologies for scope calculations, allowing us to report more precise figures which increase the total emissions reported. Scope 3 calculations remain an evolving science, and our footprint will continue to evolve with more accurate data, and due to acquisitions and changes in our business.

Job_title: Data Engineer til bekæmpelse af skatteunddragelse
Description:
Vil du være en del af et stærkt fagligt fællesskab? Er du interesseret i at arbejde med komplekse datastrukturer og samfundsvigtige opgaver? Så har vi brug for dig som ny Data Engineer!

Tre tidligere juniorer siger:

”Med forløbet er jeg kommet hurtigt ind i arbejdslivet og er blevet klædt på til at løse opgaver selvstændigt og udvikle effektivt”

” Der har været stort fokus på min udvikling og på at give mig de bedste forudsætninger for at lære. Mine kollegaer har været tålmodige og sikret at arbejdsbyrden ikke har taget overhånd”.



Vi søger flere nyuddannede Data Engineers til vores Data Engineer-forløb, der sætter din læring og kompetenceudvikling i centrum. Du får en unik mulighed for at deltage i et forløb, der er skræddersyet til juniorprofiler, og som giver dig de bedste forudsætninger for at udvikle din faglighed og for at få erfaring i en stor organisation.
DE-forløbet består af oplæg og workshops, som er tilrettelagt, udviklet og afholdt af dine kommende kollegaer i Data Warehouse og Business Intelligence. Forløbet sikrer en effektiv og målrettet onboarding, så du hurtigt får hands-on-erfaring.

Alle teams arbejder agilt inden for SAFe og har et årshjul med fire PI’s. Hvert PI afsluttes med tre dages Hackathon, der giver mere end 140 medarbejdere med forskellige fagligheder mulighed for at samarbejde på tværs om selvvalgte projekter.


Som Data Engineer bliver du en del af et stort fagligt fællesskab i Center for Data Warehouse og Business Intelligence, der består af 75+ medarbejdere, både Data Engineers, BI-udviklere, Business Analysts, Product Owners, driftsansvarlige og generalister.
Vi prioriterer tid til sparring og til at dyrke vores faglighed. Vi afholder tre årlige centerdage og et seminar med både interne og eksterne oplæg, workshops og indslag, der skal styrke vores sociale sammenhold og faglighed. Derudover har vi flere fagfællesskaber, hvori de forskellige fagligheder kan vidensdele og løse opgaver, der sikrer udvikling og forbedring af vores område.


Som Data Engineer er du bindeled mellem dataproducent og datakonsument, og du får ansvar for at indsamle, omforme, sammenstille og udveksle data på Skatteforvaltningens mange områder i vores fælles Data Warehouse.

Vi arbejder med SQL og Informatica, som er vores primære databaseværktøj. Informatica kan håndtere hele vores dataintegrations cyklus; fra indlæsning til udstilling. Det forventes ikke, at du har tidligere kendskab til værktøjet, og du vil få en grundig introduktion til det gennem onboardingforløbet.

Din rolle bliver bl.a. at:



Vi forestiller os, at du har en relevant videregående IT-faglig uddannelse, og at du har en særlig interesse for data. Du kan både være nyuddannet eller have erfaring.

Du har oparbejdet kompetencer eller interesser inden for et eller flere af områderne:


Det er desuden en fordel, hvis du har erfaring med programmering i Python, bearbejdning af semistruktureret data (XML, JSON) og ETL-processer generelt.

Koncernsproget er dansk, så vi forventer, at du kan forstå og formulere dig på dansk – både skriftligt og mundtligt.


Din leder i Data Warehouse stiller store krav til sig selv og sine medarbejdere, og har et højt ambitionsniveau på fagområdets vegne, men går ikke på kompromis med medarbejdernes trivsel. Fleksibilitet og en god work-life-balance er grundstenen i et bæredygtigt arbejdsliv. Du får en inkluderende leder, der går ind for åben og ærlig dialog. En leder, der giver ansvar, plads og medbestemmelse – fordi det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde!


Send din ansøgning med CV, dokumentation for uddannelse samt eventuelt yderligere materiale via linket ”Søg stillingen” senest mandag den 4. juni 2023. Vi indkalder løbende til samtaler.

Stillingen er med opstart 15. august 2023.

Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte kontorchef Astrid Iversen på tlf. 72 37 06 18.

Vi forventer at benytte en personlighedsanalyse og en logisk test i rekrutteringsprocessen. Der vil forud for ansættelsen blive indhentet straffeattest.

Du bliver ansat på overenskomstvilkår i henhold til gældende overenskomst for akademikere i staten, overenskomst for kontorfunktionærer, laboranter og IT-medarbejdere (HK) eller overenskomst for fuldmægtige m.fl. (DTS) i Skatteministeriet.

Ansættelsesområdet er Skatteministeriet med tilhørende institutioner. Arbejdsstedet er Osvald Helmuths Vej 4, 2000 Frederiksberg.

This role will take responsibility for the design (incl. architecture, technology choices, etc.) and day-to-day operations overseeing the and operational aspects of the transportation platform – technical operational excellence as well as outcomes for our customers and colleagues. The team will provide a global structure for customer service including controls and service sessions and protocols for service use. A vital part of the Maersk technology estate, the network platform will bridge other platforms and technologies to serve the customer in the best way possible.

Description:
Pick a point on a globe, and Maersk won’t be far away. With 90% of global trade carried by sea, there is a high chance that the shoes on your feet or the phone in your pocket travelled to you on a Maersk vessel. Would you like to impact the daily lives of people in every corner of the world? Then keep reading.
What We Do
Come join us to help utilize technology to tackle the world’s CO2 challenge!

You’ve probably heard of or have even worked with IoT devices before. But have you ever heard of IoT devices that are close to half a kilometer long, weigh in at 300,000 metric tonnes and float around in the middle of the Pacific Ocean? Well, we are lucky enough to work with these floating mega devices! We are even more fortunate to be tackling one of the most pressing issues in the world today….global warming.
But how do you mix large IoT devices with global warming?

Glad you asked! Shipping contributes to 3% of global CO2 emissions, and Maersk, as the world’s leading shipping company, has a large responsibility to tackle this issue and drive the industry towards solutions. Each decision starts with data and knowing our vessels’ data (intimately ) is part of our mission.

As a member of the tech teams in StarConnect (as we call ourselves) you will contribute to tackling the carbon pollution issue by using technology. And help us monitor our fleet’s fuel and empower our seafarers to reduce our carbon emissions.

We’re progressing well on a journey to bring our 700 container vessels online by hooking up to countless sensors onboard. But this has proven to be quite the challenge! Hardware installations & upgrades, deploying our apps and dealing with limited connectivity on remote platforms are some of the daily challenges we face in Maersk Decarb. But nothing comes easy when you’re working with such grand ambitions!
We are looking for a Senior Frontend Software Engineer for our Technical Efficiency & Data Collection team.

The team is building products deployed to the full fleet of Maersk vessels sailing around the globe. The aim of the products is to collect, automate & validate performance data from the vessels. This data is then modelled and turned into user insights & advice for energy decisions on-board and in office.

The end goal of our products is to drive fuel savings & reduce emission, to support Maersk's ambitious carbon neutral targets.

Our team is diverse! We are representing 7 nationalities and a variety of professions and specialialities - all working towards a common goal of supporting our users to reduce fuel & helping make their life easier on-board!

We're looking for an open minded, skilled, and passionate team member to help us on our product journey.

Description:
Your work days are brighter here.
At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.
About the Team
As we grow the Peakon engineering team at Workday, we are looking for an experienced Senior Frontend Engineer to join us in Copenhagen. Peakon teams own their roadmap, work collaboratively and include engineering, UI/UX design, and product management.

The Peakon team at Workday is driven by the belief that we can radically change the world of work. We believe that when an organisation listens to employee feedback and empowers every employee to drive the change they want to see, it can create more fulfilling jobs and grow in ways never before imagined.

We’re in the business of creating great places to work, so it should be no surprise that being a great place to work is our highest priority. With ambitions as big as ours, we see individual growth and development as the key strategy for growing our business.

The role is on the Language team which is dedicated to ensure we create actionable insights utilising Natural Language Processing on our very large comment dataset. We build features that allow users to understand and action employee Engagement issues. With multiple data scientists on the team you’ll get a chance to implement cutting edge machine learning and data science technologies into the product.

Job_title: Software Engineer, Energy Transition Platform, Hybrid 2+ days on average in our fantastic office! (Full remote available in some cases)
Description:
As an integrated container logistics company, A.P. Moller - Maersk is working to connect and simplify our customers’ supply chains. Every day, we facilitate and impact global trade by offering end-to-end logistics solutions across oceans, ports, air and on land. Our global network enables people in every corner of the world to trade with anyone, anywhere – ultimately creating opportunities for people and communities to thrive, and for businesses to grow.
Why should you work on the Energy Transition Platform?
The world is facing a climate emergency. We see it as our obligation – as an industry leader and with the resources available to us – to do all we can to get to net zero operations as fast as possible and to help our customers decarbonize their global supply chains end to end.
As a key player in an industry responsible for 3.5 billion tons of annual direct emissions, A.P. Moller - Maersk (Maersk) is committed to leading the decarbonization of logistics and taking responsibility to be part of the solution, enabling a green and just transition. In early 2022, we announced the ambitious goal of advancing the target year for our commitment to reach net zero emissions by a full decade, to 2040. This applies to our own operations, but – even more importantly – covers all three emission scopes and supports our customers’ own climate commitments.

Description:
Pick a point on a globe, and Maersk won’t be far away. With 90% of global trade carried by sea, there is a high chance that the shoes on your feet or the phone in your pocket travelled to you on a Maersk vessel. Would you like to impact the daily lives of people in every corner of the world? Then keep reading.
What We Do
Come join us to help utilize technology to tackle the world’s CO2 challenge!

You’ve probably heard of or have even worked with IoT devices before. But have you ever heard of IoT devices that are close to half a kilometer long, weigh in at 300,000 metric tonnes and float around in the middle of the Pacific Ocean? Well, we are lucky enough to work with these floating mega devices! We are even more fortunate to be tackling one of the most pressing issues in the world today….global warming.
But how do you mix large IoT devices with global warming?

Glad you asked! Shipping contributes to 3% of global CO2 emissions, and Maersk, as the world’s leading shipping company, has a large responsibility to tackle this issue and drive the industry towards solutions. Each decision starts with data and knowing our vessels’ data (intimately ) is part of our mission.

As a member of the tech teams in StarConnect (as we call ourselves) you will contribute to tackling the carbon pollution issue by using technology. And help us monitor our fleet’s fuel and empower our seafarers to reduce our carbon emissions.

We’re progressing well on a journey to bring our 700 container vessels online by hooking up to countless sensors onboard. But this has proven to be quite the challenge! Hardware installations & upgrades, deploying our apps and dealing with limited connectivity on remote platforms are some of the daily challenges we face in Maersk Decarb. But nothing comes easy when you’re working with such grand ambitions!
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer (Backend) for our Energy Efficiency & Data Collection team.

The team is building products deployed to the full fleet of Maersk vessels sailing around the globe. The aim of the products is to collect, automate & validate performance data from the vessels. This data is then modelled and turned into user insights & advice for energy decisions on-board and in office.

The end goal of our products is to drive fuel savings & reduce emission, to support Maersk's ambitious carbon neutral targets.

Our team is diverse! We are representing 7 nationalities and a variety of professions and specialialities - all working towards a common goal of supporting our users to reduce fuel & helping make their life easier on-board!

We're looking for an open minded, skilled, and passionate team member to help us on our product journey.

Job_title: Data Engineer til bekæmpelse af skatteunddragelse
Description:
Vil du være en del af et stærkt fagligt fællesskab? Er du interesseret i at arbejde med komplekse datastrukturer og samfundsvigtige opgaver? Så har vi brug for dig som ny Data Engineer!

Tre tidligere juniorer siger:

”Med forløbet er jeg kommet hurtigt ind i arbejdslivet og er blevet klædt på til at løse opgaver selvstændigt og udvikle effektivt”

” Der har været stort fokus på min udvikling og på at give mig de bedste forudsætninger for at lære. Mine kollegaer har været tålmodige og sikret at arbejdsbyrden ikke har taget overhånd”.



Vi søger flere nyuddannede Data Engineers til vores Data Engineer-forløb, der sætter din læring og kompetenceudvikling i centrum. Du får en unik mulighed for at deltage i et forløb, der er skræddersyet til juniorprofiler, og som giver dig de bedste forudsætninger for at udvikle din faglighed og for at få erfaring i en stor organisation.
DE-forløbet består af oplæg og workshops, som er tilrettelagt, udviklet og afholdt af dine kommende kollegaer i Data Warehouse og Business Intelligence. Forløbet sikrer en effektiv og målrettet onboarding, så du hurtigt får hands-on-erfaring.

Alle teams arbejder agilt inden for SAFe og har et årshjul med fire PI’s. Hvert PI afsluttes med tre dages Hackathon, der giver mere end 140 medarbejdere med forskellige fagligheder mulighed for at samarbejde på tværs om selvvalgte projekter.


Som Data Engineer bliver du en del af et stort fagligt fællesskab i Center for Data Warehouse og Business Intelligence, der består af 75+ medarbejdere, både Data Engineers, BI-udviklere, Business Analysts, Product Owners, driftsansvarlige og generalister.
Vi prioriterer tid til sparring og til at dyrke vores faglighed. Vi afholder tre årlige centerdage og et seminar med både interne og eksterne oplæg, workshops og indslag, der skal styrke vores sociale sammenhold og faglighed. Derudover har vi flere fagfællesskaber, hvori de forskellige fagligheder kan vidensdele og løse opgaver, der sikrer udvikling og forbedring af vores område.


Som Data Engineer er du bindeled mellem dataproducent og datakonsument, og du får ansvar for at indsamle, omforme, sammenstille og udveksle data på Skatteforvaltningens mange områder i vores fælles Data Warehouse.

Vi arbejder med SQL og Informatica, som er vores primære databaseværktøj. Informatica kan håndtere hele vores dataintegrations cyklus; fra indlæsning til udstilling. Det forventes ikke, at du har tidligere kendskab til værktøjet, og du vil få en grundig introduktion til det gennem onboardingforløbet.

Din rolle bliver bl.a. at:



Vi forestiller os, at du har en relevant videregående IT-faglig uddannelse, og at du har en særlig interesse for data. Du kan både være nyuddannet eller have erfaring.

Du har oparbejdet kompetencer eller interesser inden for et eller flere af områderne:


Det er desuden en fordel, hvis du har erfaring med programmering i Python, bearbejdning af semistruktureret data (XML, JSON) og ETL-processer generelt.

Koncernsproget er dansk, så vi forventer, at du kan forstå og formulere dig på dansk – både skriftligt og mundtligt.


Din leder i Data Warehouse stiller store krav til sig selv og sine medarbejdere, og har et højt ambitionsniveau på fagområdets vegne, men går ikke på kompromis med medarbejdernes trivsel. Fleksibilitet og en god work-life-balance er grundstenen i et bæredygtigt arbejdsliv. Du får en inkluderende leder, der går ind for åben og ærlig dialog. En leder, der giver ansvar, plads og medbestemmelse – fordi det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde!


Send din ansøgning med CV, dokumentation for uddannelse samt eventuelt yderligere materiale via linket ”Søg stillingen” senest mandag den 4. juni 2023. Vi indkalder løbende til samtaler.

Stillingen er med opstart 15. august 2023.

Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte kontorchef Astrid Iversen på tlf. 72 37 06 18.

Vi forventer at benytte en personlighedsanalyse og en logisk test i rekrutteringsprocessen. Der vil forud for ansættelsen blive indhentet straffeattest.

Du bliver ansat på overenskomstvilkår i henhold til gældende overenskomst for akademikere i staten, overenskomst for kontorfunktionærer, laboranter og IT-medarbejdere (HK) eller overenskomst for fuldmægtige m.fl. (DTS) i Skatteministeriet.

Ansættelsesområdet er Skatteministeriet med tilhørende institutioner. Arbejdsstedet er Osvald Helmuths Vej 4, 2000 Frederiksberg.

Why should you work on the Energy Transition Platform?

The world is facing a climate emergency. We see it as our obligation – as an industry leader and with the resources available to us – to do all we can to get to net zero operations as fast as possible and to help our customers decarbonize their global supply chains end to end.

Job_title: Data engineer med øje for den tværgående arkitektur
Description:
Om stillingen Statens BI sikrer, at beslutninger træffes på et oplyst og korrekt grundlag. Med data som fundament gør vi viden tilgængelig og visualiseret i den kontekst som vores kunder ønsker.

Vi har et klart og tydeligt mål om at skabe gennemsigtighed for den enkelte regnskabsbruger og at understøtte styring og resultatskabelse i de enkelte institutioner. Samtidigt skal vi opfylde Finansministeriets behov for konsolidering af viden og tværgående analyser i forbindelse med udarbejdelse af finansloven.

Det er et spændende, kompliceret og et særdeles aktuelt arbejde, hvor den enkeltes indsats kan måles direkte i de beslutninger, der træffes. BI er et strategisk vigtigt indsatsområde i Finansministeriet, hvilket afspejles i vores arbejde og den gode energi, hvormed vi tilgår vores opgaver.

Statens BI undergår konstant forandring og i takt med den teknologiske udvikling ændres brugernes behov. Derfor er vi gået i gang med at definere den næste generation af Statens BI, så hvis du vil være med til at forme fremtidens forretningsservices og teknologi for Statens BI, er det nu du skal med på rejsen.

Vi søger lige nu en eller flere data engineers, der i samarbejde med vores Product Owners, kan skabe sammenhæng på tværs af løsninger og arkitektur og sikre, at vi følger best practics. Statens BI er bygget på teknologi fra Microsoft.

Om dig Vi ser gerne, at du har følgende færdigheder:


Du vil blandt andet komme til at arbejde med:


Derudover vil du indgå i arbejdet med at definere og implementere den næste generation af Statens BI.

Om os Vi garanterer et meningsfuldt job, hvor faglige udfordringer og personlig udvikling er i fokus fra første dag. Vores BI-team består af 17 gode kollegaer, hvor faglighed og godt humør er i højsædet, for det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde.

BI-teamet indgår i Økonomistyrelsens Center for Systemer, som er et af de største it-udviklingsmiljøer i staten. I Systemcenteret er vi i alt 160 dygtige og ambitiøse it-specialister, der arbejder med it-udvikling, drift, support, infrastruktur, arkitektur og sikkerhed – alt sammen i tæt dialog med og inddragelse af vores kunder.

Hos os betyder tilstedeværelse sammen med vores kollegaer meget, og vi mener, at samarbejde og videndeling på tværs af styrelsen er afgørende for et godt arbejdsmiljø. Samtidig vil vi gerne sikre fleksibilitet for vores medarbejdere, og hjemmearbejde kan løbende aftales mellem chef og medarbejder, når det er foreneligt med opgavevaretagelsen.

Ansættelsesvilkår Du ansættes efter gældende overenskomst med mulighed for forhandling alt efter kvalifikationer.

Det er en forudsætning for ansættelse, at du kan sikkerhedsgodkendes til graden hemmeligt og efterfølgende kan opretholde sikkerhedsgodkendelsen i hele din ansættelsesperiode.

Ansættelsesområdet er Finansministeriet med tilhørende institutioner, pt. Finansministeriets departement, Statens Administration, Statens It, Økonomistyrelsen samt Medarbejder- og Kompetencestyrelsen.

Yderligere oplysninger Hvis du vil vide mere om stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte teamleder Morten Bødtcher på tlf. 20 35 01 79.

Ansøgning Vi ser frem til at modtage din ansøgning med CV, eksamenspapirer og eventuelle bilag via knappen ”Søg stillingen” senest den 17. april 2023.

Finansministeriet ser mangfoldighed som en styrke og opfordrer alle interesserede kandidater uanset personlig baggrund til at søge. Vi ser frem til at læse din ansøgning.

Job_title: Experienced Business Intelligence Developer to join our exciting data journey
Description:
Are you eager to make a difference by creating insights that are critical for business and society? Do you have a passion for designing and developing large-scale solutions for extracting, transferring, loading, modeling and analyzing data? Then maybe you are the BI developer that NNIT is looking for.
NNIT is on an exciting data journey fueled by our customers’ demand for getting better insight through data, and to keep up with the growing demand, we are looking for even more great colleagues to join our dedicated BI & Analytics team.
In close collaboration with our customers, our team designs, builds and supports everything from technical solutions, processes, adoption, and operation of customers’ business intelligence and analytics solutions.
We are currently looking for data enthusiastic colleagues with experience working in the backend of BI solutions to join our Danish team in either Copenhagen or Aarhus.

Description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Propulsion Engineer to join Orbex, this constitutes a highly versatile position which will expose you to most facets of liquid propulsion development, qualification and test. You will be a responsible engineer for propulsion systems, fluid control systems or major subsystems on our launch vehicle as well as associated ground test benches and GSE.
It is essential that applicants have both practical and theoretical experience in rocketry, it is likely that you have experience designing but also in robust testing procedures, ideally hot fire tests or similar.
The Senior Propulsion Engineer role also provides operational support to development and qualification test campaigns ranging from test plan/procedure definition, to test execution and data analysis. Additionally, senior propulsion engineers work in close, continuous collaboration with in-house production and integration teams to evolve hardware designs for improved quality and manufacturability.

Description:
My client aims to deliver the best and most relevant Data and Analytics solutions, offering both consulting and managed services. My client strives to instill trust in their customers, providing solid consulting services making the takeover of the customer's analytics services smooth without

The customer gets a carefully selected dream team that will provide a tailor-made Data & Analytics platform to cover the customer's every need. My client is currently focusing their efforts on Denmark while starting to expand throughout the Nordic countries as well as the Baltics and France.
As the new Senior Data Engineer, you will be working directly with the clients delivering data platforms and complex insights solutions. You will be key to fulfilling the customer's needs for dynamic data platforms, supporting their data-driven journey. You will be supporting and leading the development of complex data platforms and taking part in the entire life cycle of the projects. Job_title: Senior R&D Scientist / Engineer in ALD Materials & Processes
Description:
Would you like to help us revolutionize the development and manufacturing of electronic, photonics, and optics industries? Welcome to ATLANT 3D – we would like to invite you for an amazing journey where you will be a part of a team working towards disrupting 60 years of micro and nanofabrication technologies and systems. We offer you a once-in-a-lifetime experience. What we develop is unique, and we are incredibly excited to make a difference.
We are looking for a senior R&D Scientist/Engineer in ALD Materials and Processes to lead the development of new process recipes based on ALD chemistries and related technologies for ATLANT 3D.
You will join a highly skilled and dedicated team of engineers and scientists and become a key participant in developing innovative solutions within nanotechnology. Cross-functional collaboration is the key to our success. We believe in combining theory and simulation with hands-on prototyping and testing.

Lead Instrument Engineer – Renewable Energy – Contract – Copenhagen

Are you a Lead Instrument Engineer looking for your next long-term contract? This is your chance to lead a major Power-to-X project utilising Hydrogen in Copenhagen!

Our client, a global provider of professional services in the energy, chemicals and resources sector are looking to onboard an experienced Instrument Engineer with a degree in engineering from April 2023. As the Project Manager, you will be a crucial contributor to the performance of the business unit. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a worldwide team of consultants, engineers, construction workers and data scientists on an initial 12-month contract.

The role consists of site work in Copenhagen, although some European travel is expected.


Work activities will include both project and proposal work where both the technical approach and continuity must be aligned
Work activities for both projects and proposals will be executed across all phases of projects including Conceptual Studies; Basic; FEED; Detailed Design; Procurement through to Commissioning.
Projects and proposals are for process plant and facilities across the Power and Energy Transition/ New Energy sectors
Project work will include development of Instrument Engineering deliverables as required on a project by project basis
Project work as the functional Lead Engineer for projects as required by the C&I Group Manager


Degree qualified for the related discipline
Chartered Engineer status as a Member of the Institute of Measurement and Control (IMC) or Institution of Engineering and Technology (IET).
20+ years’ experience Instrument Engineering
5 + years’ experience in a Lead role on capital projects from concept to start-up
Experience of working in a client facing large project group environment
Very good proactive communicator.
Experienced at controlling man-hour budgets and scheduled delivery
Proven ability for equipment specification and selection and in ensuring compliance from the suppliers, preferably within an EPC contracting organization
Is this Lead Instrument Engineer position a good fit for you? Get in touch with us today.

The candidate must have the rights to work in the location stated in the job advert.

Are you a Lead Electrical Engineer looking for your next long-term contract? This is your chance to lead a major Power-to-X project utilising Hydrogen in Copenhagen!

Our client, a global provider of professional services in the energy, chemicals and resources sector are looking to onboard an experienced Electrical Engineer with a degree in engineering from April 2023. As the Project Manager, you will be a crucial contributor to the performance of the business unit. Manage electrical engineering services that meet our client’s and its customers' and applicable statutory and regulatory specifications, on time and within budget.

participate in relevant meetings, prepare progress reports and comply with required checking procedures;
ensure the project scope is clear and that changes comply with project change management processes;
provide advice during procurement, construction and commissioning activities. For example, oversee requisitions, technical bid evaluations and purchase order preparation.

Identify issues and problems, develop appropriate solutions, and ask for assistance when required.


Relevant engineering degree.
Chartered Professional Engineer (CPEng) status.
Relevant postgraduate qualifications in engineering; management, project management or supervisory qualifications or equivalent.
Excellent IT skills
Excellent technical and practical engineering skills and ability to consistently deliver quality, accurate and timely work to with our client and its clients.
Excellent knowledge of the fundamental requirements of the electrical engineering
Excellent knowledge of applicable local and international standards and regulatory specifications.

Description:
ViaBill operates at the intersection of the eCommerce, payments and consumer credit sectors, and is an industry pioneer and early market entrant in the BNPL industry, which is experiencing rapid growth. Becoming the best at something isn’t easy. It takes skill, hard work, and an unmatched level of ambition and determination. Our team is international, experienced and most of all, hardworking. In just a few years, we’ve grown from our first office in an art gallery in Denmark to having our teams located all over the globe.
From a handful of customers to handling transactions worth more than $150M per year, we aren’t afraid of new challenges and new markets. Our strategy has been validated with external investment from leading VCs Headline and BlackFin Capital Partners.

Description:
Brandwatch is the world’s premier social suite, empowering over 7,500 of the world’s most admired companies to understand and engage with customers at the speed of social.

Combining pioneering, AI-enriched digital consumer intelligence with industry-leading social media management tools, Brandwatch offers a complementary suite of specialized, best-in-class products and services that support intelligently connected workflows. Operating and serving clients the world over, Brandwatch has 15 offices across the globe and more than 1,000 employees worldwide. Brandwatch is a Cision Company.

Description:
Are you passionate about data engineering and leading others who share your enthusiasm and do you want to be a part of data driven growth at the world’s largest jewellery brand?

Manage, engineer and evolve high quality data products across product lines on our Azure Paas data platform
At Pandora, we are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new manager of data engineer team you and your team will collaborate with product owners & managers, architects and other key profiles across the global organisation helping business verticals and clusters maximising the value of our data and drive business change as an impact of this. You will lead a team of equal minded data engineers at different seniority levels.

Your primary focus will be to secure that you and your team designs, builds and implements scalable and innovative data products on our global data platform and to secure ownership and stability of the products.

Description:
Do you want to develop, build and deliver advanced data products to support data-driven decision-making across the value chain of ECCO?
Join us at ECCO Advanced Analytics, located in Copenhagen, to help grow our advanced analytics platform and become one of the key enablers in our future setup. We are highly motivated, collaborative and fun-loving, with an entrepreneurial spirit and a bias for action. Given a broad mandate to explore, experiment and innovate, we are growing at an unprecedented rate with a seemingly endless range of new opportunities.
JOB PROFILE
You will join highly skilled colleagues in Advanced Analytics. We lead our advanced analytics initiatives and capabilities in the ECCO Group and drive an ambitious strategy to support the transformation to a data-driven organization using the leading business principles herein. You will report to the Data & Platform Engineering Team Lead and work out of our office at Carlsbergbyen in Copenhagen.

You will work closely with our data scientists and analysts to deliver high-impact datasets and algorithms into our daily business operations and strategic initiatives.

Description:
Join the sustainability journey at NREP
NREP is a powerhouse of brilliant and caring people who are raising the bar for the industry. By improving the design, constrauction ans use of urban real estate - with sustainability at the core - they are driving change to create real impact. With a mission to be a global thought leader of urban ecosystems, investing for positive planetary impact, an ambitious goal to reach net zero carbon emissions by 2028. Using their data assets wisely and harvesting new insights from data is key to pushing forward this vision and goal. To keep on innovating and raising the bar for NREP’s data platform, they are now looking for a talented Data Engineer to a newly established role, who wants to embark on an ambitious growth path.

The Team

Data Engineer
Do you want to transform the way clinical data is efficiently handled and shared across the business – aspiring to create value throughout the value chain by enabling real-time analytics of our clinical data, including data from clinical studies, real world data, multi omics, images, streaming data and more?

We are looking for a Data Engineer who will join our efforts to sustain and further advance our ambition to become a global healthcare leader powered by data, analytics, and digital technologies – and drive change to help defeat diabetes and other chronic diseases.
If the above excites you, then join us in Data Science where you can get to put your skills into purposeful action to help build our next generation clinical data infrastructure. As a Data Engineer, you will be a part of driving outcomes and solutions that will transform the way we operate, and significantly impact the way we develop new medicines to patients, and value for Novo Nordisk Development.


As we have embarked on a transformation journey to build our Next Generation Data Infrastructure, we need a data engineer drive setting up the right data model across different data modalities considering both structured and less structured data types in high volumes. The infrastructure will cater for streaming analytics and FAIR data principles. With an ambitious vision to grow our activities 10X over the coming years we need to re-think how we enable a data seamless flow across clinical system ultimately enabling innovative medicines to patients faster and in the right quality. The program is anchored within Data Science in the Development organisation in Novo Nordisk (NN).

Description:
Linkfire is looking for a full-time Data Engineer in Copenhagen, Lisbon or remote (EMEA) to support our missions to create value through data. You will join us to continue discovering and delivering new and exciting features for the 150+ million fans which we bring closer to their favorite artists every month.
You will join a company with roots and heart in music. We're a team of designers, engineers, product managers and more, drawn from every corner of the globe.
Our goal? Empowering entertainment discovery everywhere!

What you will do at Linkfire

Do you like working with a variety of tasks, while always having a focus on developing high level technical solutions? Are you looking for a place where you explore and develop your skills in fields like code libraries, data pipelines and IaC. Does teamwork with daily discussions and input motivate you?
Then this job is the right one for you.
The Copenhagen Metro (Metroselskabet I/S) is looking for an experienced Data Engineer/Backend developer to join our DataLake team in the department of Digitalization and Technology. We expect that you are competent with designing, architecting, as well as developing solutions for a DataLake. We are using Google Cloud and want to strengthen the setup as well as build up an API-capability to receive data.
The DataLake already has several data sources but is going to increase this number over the coming years. Currently Data Lake includes data on KPI-measurement, automating data-triggered processes as well as advanced data analytics. In the future we want to include several IoT sources, build a data-driven ESG-reporting setup, utilize ML related to predictive maintenance, remove tedious tasks in business unit with data-driven automated support as well as start to use streaming data.

Description:
Pick a point on a globe, and Maersk won’t be far away. With 90% of global trade carried by sea, there is a high chance that the shoes on your feet or the phone in your pocket travelled to you on a Maersk vessel. Would you like to impact the daily lives of people in every corner of the world? Then keep reading.
What We Do
Come join us to help utilize technology to tackle the world’s CO2 challenge!

You’ve probably heard of or have even worked with IoT devices before. But have you ever heard of IoT devices that are close to half a kilometer long, weigh in at 300,000 metric tonnes and float around in the middle of the Pacific Ocean? Well, we are lucky enough to work with these floating mega devices! We are even more fortunate to be tackling one of the most pressing issues in the world today….global warming.
But how do you mix large IoT devices with global warming?

Glad you asked! Shipping contributes to 3% of global CO2 emissions, and Maersk, as the world’s leading shipping company, has a large responsibility to tackle this issue and drive the industry towards solutions. Each decision starts with data and knowing our vessels’ data (intimately ) is part of our mission.

As a member of the tech teams in StarConnect (as we call ourselves) you will contribute to tackling the carbon pollution issue by using technology. And help us monitor our fleet’s fuel and empower our seafarers to reduce our carbon emissions.

We’re progressing well on a journey to bring our 700 container vessels online by hooking up to countless sensors onboard. But this has proven to be quite the challenge! Hardware installations & upgrades, deploying our apps and dealing with limited connectivity on remote platforms are some of the daily challenges we face in Maersk Decarb. But nothing comes easy when you’re working with such grand ambitions!
We are looking for a Senior Frontend Software Engineer for our Technical Efficiency & Data Collection team.

The team is building products deployed to the full fleet of Maersk vessels sailing around the globe. The aim of the products is to collect, automate & validate performance data from the vessels. This data is then modelled and turned into user insights & advice for energy decisions on-board and in office.

The end goal of our products is to drive fuel savings & reduce emission, to support Maersk's ambitious carbon neutral targets.

Our team is diverse! We are representing 7 nationalities and a variety of professions and specialialities - all working towards a common goal of supporting our users to reduce fuel & helping make their life easier on-board!

We're looking for an open minded, skilled, and passionate team member to help us on our product journey.

Description:
Make your ability count at NNE
We are experts in end-to-end pharma engineering, and our success is built on our relationships, both with our colleagues and our customers. If you want to work on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.
Work with us
Do you work with cloud services, have you used CDK and are familiar with CI/CD pipelines? Is programming like second nature to you? Does building real-time data connectivity pipelines supporting advanced analytics pique your interest? Would you like to improve your skills in building cloud-based applications in AWS or Azure/Databricks? Then join our Manufacturing Intelligence team in Copenhagen and become our next Consultant within Cloud- and Data Engineering!

NNE Manufacturing Intelligence is a full-service provider of intelligence solutions within pharma manufacturing. We work with all aspects of data engineering/data science from cloud services, consultancy services, design, implementation, test/validation, and data analytics, machine learning to AI. Our specialty is data connectivity solutions for Pharma manufacturing, that enable data-driven decision-making, automation of processes and faster access to critical production data.



We are looking for an experienced data engineer or recent graduate with relevant work experience, who is outgoing, curious and engaged, and holds high ambitions for ensuring great quality in own work, and a willingness to share and learn from your peers. You will be asked to contribute, from day one, to our growing team of diverse Data Engineers and Data Scientists.

Your role as a Consultant in Manufacturing Intelligence will be to develop, test and implement the next generation of cloud solutions for pharma manufacturing environments. Collaborate with customers to turn ideas into value adding solutions and supporting them in every step of the way from design to implementation; and lastly, you will be a part of the project teams and participate on equal terms with your 50+ committed colleagues in Denmark and India.

We offer colleagues with pharma domain knowledge that can further advance your cloud skills within this field, along with hundreds of years of experience in pharma engineering.

Description:
Let’s reimagine how the world moves.
As an international business on a high-tech journey, we don’t just transport millions of tons of cargo. We’re leading a digital revolution in global trade, creating opportunities for millions of customers around the world through new technology, data science, and artificial intelligence.
Growing your skills with Maersk means growing global trade and reinventing our industry, creating a digital foundation that moves the world. But it also means creating life-enhancing prosperity for people and communities through exciting initiatives.
Where will your technology career move next?
Maersk offers a unique opportunity to be part of a truly global team working on optimizing, expanding, and refining the Workday and other HR Technology solutions within Maersk. You will be part of the HR Technology organization working across our Product delivery teams.

In the team we strive to be agile and move fast when needed. We want to go beyond issue diagnostics and be a proactive advisor on solutions and drive optimization of our processes and systems. Our main stakeholder is the HR organization, and we are here to support them. They come to us with global and local requirements, and we act as trusted advisors and listen and translate complex challenges to viable technical Workday solutions.

Description:
Lead Instrument Engineer – Renewable Energy – Contract – Copenhagen

Are you a Lead Instrument Engineer looking for your next long-term contract? This is your chance to lead a major Power-to-X project utilising Hydrogen in Copenhagen!

Our client, a global provider of professional services in the energy, chemicals and resources sector are looking to onboard an experienced Instrument Engineer with a degree in engineering from April 2023. As the Project Manager, you will be a crucial contributor to the performance of the business unit. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a worldwide team of consultants, engineers, construction workers and data scientists on an initial 12-month contract.

The role consists of site work in Copenhagen, although some European travel is expected.

ViaBill operates at the intersection of the eCommerce, payments and consumer credit sectors, and is an industry pioneer and early market entrant in the BNPL industry, which is experiencing rapid growth. In just a few years, we’ve grown from our first office in an art gallery in Denmark to having our teams located all over the globe.
From a handful of customers to handling transactions worth more than $150M per year, we aren’t afraid of new challenges and new markets. Our strategy has been validated with external investment from leading VCs Headline and BlackFin Capital Partners.

Description:
Data Engineer
Do you want to transform the way clinical data is efficiently handled and shared across the business – aspiring to create value throughout the value chain by enabling real-time analytics of our clinical data, including data from clinical studies, real world data, multi omics, images, streaming data and more?

We are looking for a Data Engineer who will join our efforts to sustain and further advance our ambition to become a global healthcare leader powered by data, analytics, and digital technologies – and drive change to help defeat diabetes and other chronic diseases.
If the above excites you, then join us in Data Science where you can get to put your skills into purposeful action to help build our next generation clinical data infrastructure. As a Data Engineer, you will be a part of driving outcomes and solutions that will transform the way we operate, and significantly impact the way we develop new medicines to patients, and value for Novo Nordisk Development.


As we have embarked on a transformation journey to build our Next Generation Data Infrastructure, we need a data engineer drive setting up the right data model across different data modalities considering both structured and less structured data types in high volumes. The infrastructure will cater for streaming analytics and FAIR data principles. With an ambitious vision to grow our activities 10X over the coming years we need to re-think how we enable a data seamless flow across clinical system ultimately enabling innovative medicines to patients faster and in the right quality. The program is anchored within Data Science in the Development organisation in Novo Nordisk (NN).

Description:
Do you want to develop, build and deliver advanced data products to support data-driven decision-making across the value chain of ECCO?
Join us at ECCO Advanced Analytics, located in Copenhagen, to help grow our advanced analytics platform and become one of the key enablers in our future setup. We are highly motivated, collaborative and fun-loving, with an entrepreneurial spirit and a bias for action. Given a broad mandate to explore, experiment and innovate, we are growing at an unprecedented rate with a seemingly endless range of new opportunities.
JOB PROFILE
You will join highly skilled colleagues in Advanced Analytics. We lead our advanced analytics initiatives and capabilities in the ECCO Group and drive an ambitious strategy to support the transformation to a data-driven organization using the leading business principles herein. You will report to the Data & Platform Engineering Team Lead and work out of our office at Carlsbergbyen in Copenhagen.
As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our data delivery and developing our data models. You will work closely with our data scientists and analysts to deliver high-impact datasets and algorithms into our daily business operations and strategic initiatives.

Description:
Join the sustainability journey at NREP
NREP is a powerhouse of brilliant and caring people who are raising the bar for the industry. By improving the design, constrauction ans use of urban real estate - with sustainability at the core - they are driving change to create real impact. With a mission to be a global thought leader of urban ecosystems, investing for positive planetary impact, an ambitious goal to reach net zero carbon emissions by 2028. Using their data assets wisely and harvesting new insights from data is key to pushing forward this vision and goal. To keep on innovating and raising the bar for NREP’s data platform, they are now looking for a talented Data Engineer to a newly established role, who wants to embark on an ambitious growth path.

The Team

Do you have a passion for data and data science? And do you take pride in your data assets and the data-driven decisions and insights they generate? Then come join our team of Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the SuperAI Centre of Excellence in Danske Bank!
For 150 years, Danske Bank has strived to be a driver of growth and development in society. In this time, the bank has amassed experience and huge volumes of data that has and can be connected to open a treasure trove of information with societal impact.
As a team, we assist in uncovering and preventing money laundering and other financial crimes, provide credit risk metrics that ensure Danske Bank has a real-time data-driven understanding of the risks it takes on and, conduct academic research to further data efforts within the financial sector.

Description:
Do you like working with a variety of tasks, while always having a focus on developing high level technical solutions? Are you looking for a place where you explore and develop your skills in fields like code libraries, data pipelines and IaC. Does teamwork with daily discussions and input motivate you?
Then this job is the right one for you.
The Copenhagen Metro (Metroselskabet I/S) is looking for an experienced Data Engineer/Backend developer to join our DataLake team in the department of Digitalization and Technology. We expect that you are competent with designing, architecting, as well as developing solutions for a DataLake. We are using Google Cloud and want to strengthen the setup as well as build up an API-capability to receive data.
The DataLake already has several data sources but is going to increase this number over the coming years. Currently Data Lake includes data on KPI-measurement, automating data-triggered processes as well as advanced data analytics. In the future we want to include several IoT sources, build a data-driven ESG-reporting setup, utilize ML related to predictive maintenance, remove tedious tasks in business unit with data-driven automated support as well as start to use streaming data.

The team is responsible for capturing, processing and delivering real time data on athlete performance from our cutting-edge radar and computer vision-based tracking technology. Our products are used by some of the best athletes in the world. Our team is building high performance and flexible data solutions and cloud services. We work closely with our peers in data science, business intelligence and application development, enabling them to focus on delivering compelling product experiences. We focus on the problem of running data operations at scale with a lean team using automation and the latest data frameworks and cloud technologies.

Description:
Make your ability count at NNE
We are experts in end-to-end pharma engineering, and our success is built on our relationships, both with our colleagues and our customers. If you want to work on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.
Work with us
Do you work with cloud services, have you used CDK and are familiar with CI/CD pipelines? Is programming like second nature to you? Does building real-time data connectivity pipelines supporting advanced analytics pique your interest? Would you like to improve your skills in building cloud-based applications in AWS or Azure/Databricks? Then join our Manufacturing Intelligence team in Copenhagen and become our next Consultant within Cloud- and Data Engineering!

NNE Manufacturing Intelligence is a full-service provider of intelligence solutions within pharma manufacturing. We work with all aspects of data engineering/data science from cloud services, consultancy services, design, implementation, test/validation, and data analytics, machine learning to AI. Our specialty is data connectivity solutions for Pharma manufacturing, that enable data-driven decision-making, automation of processes and faster access to critical production data.



We are looking for an experienced data engineer or recent graduate with relevant work experience, who is outgoing, curious and engaged, and holds high ambitions for ensuring great quality in own work, and a willingness to share and learn from your peers. You will be asked to contribute, from day one, to our growing team of diverse Data Engineers and Data Scientists.

Your role as a Consultant in Manufacturing Intelligence will be to develop, test and implement the next generation of cloud solutions for pharma manufacturing environments. Collaborate with customers to turn ideas into value adding solutions and supporting them in every step of the way from design to implementation; and lastly, you will be a part of the project teams and participate on equal terms with your 50+ committed colleagues in Denmark and India.

We offer colleagues with pharma domain knowledge that can further advance your cloud skills within this field, along with hundreds of years of experience in pharma engineering.

Description:
Pick a point on a globe, and Maersk won’t be far away. With 90% of global trade carried by sea, there is a high chance that the shoes on your feet or the phone in your pocket travelled to you on a Maersk vessel. Would you like to impact the daily lives of people in every corner of the world? Then keep reading.
What We Do
Come join us to help utilize technology to tackle the world’s CO2 challenge!

You’ve probably heard of or have even worked with IoT devices before. But have you ever heard of IoT devices that are close to half a kilometer long, weigh in at 300,000 metric tonnes and float around in the middle of the Pacific Ocean? Well, we are lucky enough to work with these floating mega devices! We are even more fortunate to be tackling one of the most pressing issues in the world today….global warming.
But how do you mix large IoT devices with global warming?

Glad you asked! Shipping contributes to 3% of global CO2 emissions, and Maersk, as the world’s leading shipping company, has a large responsibility to tackle this issue and drive the industry towards solutions. Each decision starts with data and knowing our vessels’ data (intimately ) is part of our mission.

As a member of the tech teams in StarConnect (as we call ourselves) you will contribute to tackling the carbon pollution issue by using technology. And help us monitor our fleet’s fuel and empower our seafarers to reduce our carbon emissions.

We’re progressing well on a journey to bring our 700 container vessels online by hooking up to countless sensors onboard. But this has proven to be quite the challenge! Hardware installations & upgrades, deploying our apps and dealing with limited connectivity on remote platforms are some of the daily challenges we face in Maersk Decarb. But nothing comes easy when you’re working with such grand ambitions!
We are looking for a Senior Frontend Software Engineer for our Technical Efficiency & Data Collection team.

The team is building products deployed to the full fleet of Maersk vessels sailing around the globe. The aim of the products is to collect, automate & validate performance data from the vessels. This data is then modelled and turned into user insights & advice for energy decisions on-board and in office.

The end goal of our products is to drive fuel savings & reduce emission, to support Maersk's ambitious carbon neutral targets.

Our team is diverse! We are representing 7 nationalities and a variety of professions and specialialities - all working towards a common goal of supporting our users to reduce fuel & helping make their life easier on-board!

We're looking for an open minded, skilled, and passionate team member to help us on our product journey.

Description:
Maersk is going through times of unprecedented change. From the farm to your refrigerator, the factory to your wardrobe, we are developing solutions that meet customer needs from one end of the supply chain to the other. Digitization and IT are taking centre stage in enabling our customers to trade globally, and we are building our core products in-house. Join the world’s leading container shipping company as we embark on an industry-defining digital transformation that will revolutionize trade. You will be joining an IT organization consisting of more than 4000 dedicated individuals. It is an outstanding opportunity for a career in a highly skilled global organization.

We offer
You will be part of the Service Delivery Platform focused on streamlining and automating ocean container operations through advanced software solutions. Our software products are used by customers, Maersk’s operations front-line staff, and vendors assisting with Maersk’s operations across the globe. We aim to reduce manual processes to a minimum and let our Service Delivery products plan and execute operational decisions.

Job_title: Senior Data & Automation Engineer HR Technology
Description:
Let’s reimagine how the world moves.
As an international business on a high-tech journey, we don’t just transport millions of tons of cargo. We’re leading a digital revolution in global trade, creating opportunities for millions of customers around the world through new technology, data science, and artificial intelligence.
Growing your skills with Maersk means growing global trade and reinventing our industry, creating a digital foundation that moves the world. But it also means creating life-enhancing prosperity for people and communities through exciting initiatives.
Where will your technology career move next?
Maersk offers a unique opportunity to be part of a truly global team working on optimizing, expanding, and refining the Workday and other HR Technology solutions within Maersk. You will be part of the HR Technology organization working across our Product delivery teams.

In the team we strive to be agile and move fast when needed. We want to go beyond issue diagnostics and be a proactive advisor on solutions and drive optimization of our processes and systems. Our main stakeholder is the HR organization, and we are here to support them. They come to us with global and local requirements, and we act as trusted advisors and listen and translate complex challenges to viable technical Workday solutions.

What we are looking for

Description:
Lead Instrument Engineer – Renewable Energy – Contract – Copenhagen

Are you a Lead Instrument Engineer looking for your next long-term contract? This is your chance to lead a major Power-to-X project utilising Hydrogen in Copenhagen!

Our client, a global provider of professional services in the energy, chemicals and resources sector are looking to onboard an experienced Instrument Engineer with a degree in engineering from April 2023. As the Project Manager, you will be a crucial contributor to the performance of the business unit. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a worldwide team of consultants, engineers, construction workers and data scientists on an initial 12-month contract.

The role consists of site work in Copenhagen, although some European travel is expected.


Work activities will include both project and proposal work where both the technical approach and continuity must be aligned
Work activities for both projects and proposals will be executed across all phases of projects including Conceptual Studies; Basic; FEED; Detailed Design; Procurement through to Commissioning.
Projects and proposals are for process plant and facilities across the Power and Energy Transition/ New Energy sectors
Project work will include development of Instrument Engineering deliverables as required on a project by project basis
Project work as the functional Lead Engineer for projects as required by the C&I Group Manager


Degree qualified for the related discipline
Chartered Engineer status as a Member of the Institute of Measurement and Control (IMC) or Institution of Engineering and Technology (IET).
20+ years’ experience Instrument Engineering
5 + years’ experience in a Lead role on capital projects from concept to start-up
Experience of working in a client facing large project group environment
Very good proactive communicator.
Experienced at controlling man-hour budgets and scheduled delivery
Proven ability for equipment specification and selection and in ensuring compliance from the suppliers, preferably within an EPC contracting organization
Is this Lead Instrument Engineer position a good fit for you? Get in touch with us today.

The candidate must have the rights to work in the location stated in the job advert.

Please note, Quanta part of QCS Staffing does not sponsor Visa applications.

Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders—empowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact.

Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting, technology and design, and corporate and digital ventures. Description:
Data Engineer
Do you want to transform the way clinical data is efficiently handled and shared across the business – aspiring to create value throughout the value chain by enabling real-time analytics of our clinical data, including data from clinical studies, real world data, multi omics, images, streaming data and more?

We are looking for a Data Engineer who will join our efforts to sustain and further advance our ambition to become a global healthcare leader powered by data, analytics, and digital technologies – and drive change to help defeat diabetes and other chronic diseases.
If the above excites you, then join us in Data Science where you can get to put your skills into purposeful action to help build our next generation clinical data infrastructure. As a Data Engineer, you will be a part of driving outcomes and solutions that will transform the way we operate, and significantly impact the way we develop new medicines to patients, and value for Novo Nordisk Development.


As we have embarked on a transformation journey to build our Next Generation Data Infrastructure, we need a data engineer drive setting up the right data model across different data modalities considering both structured and less structured data types in high volumes. The infrastructure will cater for streaming analytics and FAIR data principles. With an ambitious vision to grow our activities 10X over the coming years we need to re-think how we enable a data seamless flow across clinical system ultimately enabling innovative medicines to patients faster and in the right quality. The program is anchored within Data Science in the Development organisation in Novo Nordisk (NN).

Description:
Do you want to develop, build and deliver advanced data products to support data-driven decision-making across the value chain of ECCO?

Given a broad mandate to explore, experiment and innovate, we are growing at an unprecedented rate with a seemingly endless range of new opportunities.

You will work closely with our data scientists and analysts to deliver high-impact datasets and algorithms into our daily business operations and strategic initiatives.
